Reviews.Title: “A few remarks”
Reviews.Author: HPBKraaijeveld
Reviews.Content: It's been a while since we've visited this hotel in Paris. Overall our stay was not what we expected it to be. We made some remarks and the receptiondesk asked us NOT to post a review on TA; they promised to make up for the mistakes made. However, they did not contact us anymore (and rest assured; I've given them some time) and we subsequently were not 'tempted' to make another reservation. Obviously there are some pro's to mention about this hotel. Hughe rooms, very nicely decorated and immaculately clean. Staff is helpfull and friendly. Recommandations for restaurants can be improved. Location is good (16th, residential neighbourhood) but not the best in Paris. But easy to reach by car and always a subway-station - rather - closeby. However, if you compare this hotel - pricewise only - with other 5-star addresses in Paris, I would not stay here again. For starters; no elevator. Parking offered is a problem; for somewhat larger cars (not so strange in this segment) the parking spaces offered are just too small. I had to park in the street and was initially charged for one of their private parking (...). But foremost, the way they persisted in asking us not to post a review without ever contacting us again is definately not the way it should be. It's a nice place but certainly not the best value for money in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A Parisian Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Pointroaddurban
Reviews.Content: This is not my first stay at Jays Paris, but this is my first review ever on TripAdvisor. That is how strongly I feel about this beautiful Parisian gem. My wife and I stayed for 4 nights this past week, from Wednesday until Sunday. We were on our way to Rome on business and decided to drop in on Judy, Philippe and the wonderful staff at Jays. On our arrival, champagne was served before we even had time to drop our bags off. The room was how I remembered it. Clean, comfortable and most importantly for me, quiet. Very glad the hotel has no bar. This 1850's exquisitely maintain building is in the middle of everything anyone ever looks for in Paris. Great restaurants, bistros, boulangerie and bars within a casual stroll of the hotel, not to mention, The Eiffel Tower, The Champs Élysées within view. Just want to say a big thank you to all at Jays for the relaxing stay. Sincerely hope to see you again............soon!

Reviews.Title: “Jays Paris IS #1”
Reviews.Author: MarieSJC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. It is luxurious, brightly sun-lit, and the staff anticipates your every need. We were warmly greeted at reception with champagne, not only upon our arrival at check in, but also after returning from dinner each night. The hotel is ideally located between the Arc, Champs Elysees and, of course, the Eiffel Tower. All within walking distance. We stayed in Room 103, the Suite Fantaisie, for 4 nights. There is free wifi internet which is rare in our travels these days. Fresh fruit and chocolates were such a lovely touch. The bathroom amenities ideally included Hermes and Clarins. The room is very spacious, with a small kitchenette-type area with dishes and glasses. The bed is very comfortable with a fluffy down duvet. French. French. French. Although the hotel does not have a restaurant or bar, there are so many to choose from in the neighborhood. The concierge will guide you, and make reservations as well. Scrumptious referrals to lovely bistros, restaurants, patisseries, boulangeries...voila! Thank you, Jays Hotel, you truly make us feel at home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Place!”
Reviews.Author: KimD49022
Reviews.Content: Everything was absolutely wonderful with our stay at JAYS! We were totally spoiled with every aspect. The concierge made excellent dining recommendations for us and greeted us warmly every time we entered or exited the building. The chocolates and afternoon fruit tray were a treat as was the champagne in the lobby area. JAYS has won a special place in our heart and a trip to Paris would never be the same without staying there!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: BakedQuahog
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights during the last week of Feb 2012 and had an absolutely wonderful time at this hotel. Excellent, convenient location, service was top-notch and the room was great. Hope to be back to Paris soon and will definitely plan to stay at Jay’s again! Not even interested in researching another hotel. Worth the price and a must-visit!

Reviews.Title: “Not your ordinary hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nealjasp
Reviews.Content: Despite always wanting to visit Paris, as with many places close by, I have never actually got around to it. So I chose Jays on the basis of its trip advisor reviews, obviously I have no direct comparison that I can make with regard to other Parisian hotels in terms of accomodation or price. What I can say about Jays is that I would liken it to staying with a friend rather than staying at a hotel. The 'personalisation' of the experience was second to none, we were greeted by name before opening our mouths and that is the level of attention received thereafter. We were greeted whenever we appeared in the lobby either to leave or arrive back, offered drinks and refreshments each time - it really was a case of ' nothing was too much trouble '. I simply cannot believe that any other city hotel could have done the same. No this hotel does not have a pool and steam room, a huge restuarant or well stocked bar but that is not what Jays is about and why would you need them when you are surrounded by more restaurants than you could visit in a month of Sundays! The staff spend time with you advising on how to get the best out of Paris, places to visit, places to eat ( of course you may not always agree with the choices but that is personal opinion ) and all really go above and beyond. I have only ever received service at this level from establishment owners and the odd member of staff - not the whole team. We were upgraded upon arrival to a second floor suite ( the hotel seemed quieter than I expected and maybe it was a slow period but it is still a nice touch to be upgraded), the room was spacious, clean and comfortable - the fruit left each day was lovely and the chocolates enjoyed by my other half! Everything you could need was in the room, right down to an i pod dock to recharge your phone - the only thing they could have done was provide some fresh milk in the fridge - all the drink making facilities were available but no milk. Breakfast is extra ( 10 euros each ) and nothing to get excited about but again you are surrounded with so much choice within five minutes walk that it is really not a problem. Its location is ideal to visit all the attractions and if you use the Metro anywhere within the City is easily and cheaply accesible. My only regret - I forgot to leave my envelope with a tip for the excellent staff, it got packed in my case by mistake - so apologies to all - will double it up next time! I really would not believe any guest who stays at Jays and said they were dissapointed - if you are then you must be used to staying in places only used by the very wealthy and paying the price tag to match.

Reviews.Title: “lovely place for a birthday treat”
Reviews.Author: sasha80
Reviews.Content: we stayed at jays for 3 nights last week for my 50th birthday. We enjoyed it very much. we did not have breakfast as we like to get up late and eat brunch on holiday however, there are many places to eat close by and this was perfect for us. The staff were all very helpful and professional and we enjoyed their company during the evenings when we were treated to generous amounts of champagne, nibbles, coffee, biscuits etc. Staff were very knowledgeable about where to eat, sightseeing etc and always friendly. My husband particularly enjoyed discussing learning to fly with one member of staff! this is a laid back place with very high standards. the room was immaculate and very quiet at night. After a nightmare hotel on a previous visit to Paris, staying at Jays was a welcome break. Thank you for making it special - hopefully, we can stay again. merci beaucoup from Liverpool.

Reviews.Title: “We have found the only place to stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Morningside22
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have just returned from a four night stay at 'JAYS' -From the moment you arrive you just feel very much at home and looked after. We mainly delt with Roman but saw and spoke to the other staff too and they are all fantastic. The rooms are fab and the atmosphere relaxed- always. I can't understand other review's about no restaurant etc. There is so many places to eat you don't need a restaurant and they will do anything to find you want you want. I hate big hotels with no feeling this is not a hotel but a beautiful house with 5 luxuary rooms and fantastic staff. Each day we had beautiful fruit and flowers delivered to our room to welcome us from our day and ample breakfast (also delivered at no extra cost) to start our day. Thank you Roman for our champagne start to every evening and to all the staff for making us so welcome, can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: James H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Jays for three nights in January as part of a birthday trip. We booked on the basis of its Trip Advisor reviews. As a result our expectations were high, but it's fair to say they were exceeded in every respect. The building is charming, the rooms are very spacious and beautifully decorated, the location is superb. The staff, in particular, were fantastic - incredibly helpful and interested without being obtrusive, and in a sincere way that is often lacking at top end hotels. My wife loved being greeted with the offer of a glass of champagne on our return to the hotel. My wife is a vegetarian which has meant we have struggled to find suitable restaurants in France on previous vists, but the Jays staff were able to recommend some lovely restaurants for us to eat in. I have stayed at a variety of five star hotels, but Jays is something much more. I saw another recent review which said it was like staying in the guest room suite of your friend's beuatiful home, and I think that summarises the experience perfectly. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Tres Magnifique”
Reviews.Author: TigersGreat
Reviews.Content: Every staff member, every facility in the lounge, every facility in the room exceeded our expectations. These expectations were high given Jays reputation, but they managed to exceed everyone of them. We cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You TripAdvisor Reviewers”
Reviews.Author: len126
Reviews.Content: I booked four days at Jays for my wife and I on the strength of the reviews on TripAdvisor. I am certainly glad I did. This was the most perfect hotel experience we've ever had. It was like staying in the guest room suite of your friend's beautiful home. The staff here are what make this place so amazing. They anticipated any need we might have had, made restaurant recommendations within walking distance (don't miss Maree de Passy, a remarkable seafood restaurant) and reservations, printed maps for anywhere we wanted to go, and made coffee or tea or gave us glasses of champagne when we returned from our day's sightseeing. The location is terrific - just a few blocks from the Champs Elysee near the Arc de Triomphe and just across the river from the Eiffel Tower. It was delightful to be in quiet surroundings at night as our suite was set back from the street. We will certainly return. Thank you, Judy and staff, for a wonderful stay at Jays.

Reviews.Title: “A truly remarkable hotel experience! Staying in Paris will never be the same again.”
Reviews.Author: MattnRachel
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Jays late on a Friday night to a delightful champagne welcome from the staff. During our two night stay the service from the small team of staff was impeccable. They couldn't do enough to help; coming to meet us at the door, asking where we had been that day. They were so friendly, always courteous and genuinely delighted to help. The hotel itself is a great conversion of a former parisian town house. Inside it is clean, light and spacious, with plenty left of the original buildings character. With only five rooms over two floors we found the hotel to be quiet and very private indeed. The daily fruit dish is a nice touch as was the weather report delivered to our room each morning. The breakfast buffet was also a pleasant surprise, having read some other reviews I thought this might be a weak spot, but it was good, with more than enough for us to eat and drink. Staying with Jays really elevated our Paris weekend break to a higher level. Ivan, Michel & Juan, thank you for making our stay so memorable. Judy, thank you for running such an amazing hotel! We will be back. Matt & Rachel, London.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant reason to return again to Paris”
Reviews.Author: 2Warrenup
Reviews.Content: JAYS Paris leading up to arrival is quite deceptive – it is many times better than expectations. It is truly a very elegant and sophisticated facility, a home from home, the best we have found in over thirty years of frequent travel. It may not suit the infrequent traveller or those that prefer the artificial environment of a 3,000 passenger cruise ship or large 5-star hotels with perceived facilities to pamper those demanding attention. JAYS has the subtle capability of meeting all requirements of frequent travellers accustomed to living away from home in style.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and very different”
Reviews.Author: francophile637
Reviews.Content: Do not listen to the latest (French language) review (5th Jan by Hsien698) - they have clearly missed the point, this special place makes no pretence of being a five star hotel, it is something completely different, catering to a clientele who don't want the large palace hotel experience.  There would have been only one member of staff on as in the evening that is all that is required given there are only 5 rooms.  I have just spent 2 nights here with my wife.  The staff are very attentive from the moment they receive the booking; they recommended and booked restaurants for us in advance and always replied immediately to our e-mails.  The welcome and service once you arrive strikes the right balance between professional and personal and nothing is too much trouble. For example my wife forgot her mobile phone charger, and one of the staff brought her one in for her to borrow from his home. The rooms are astonishingly big for such a location, with bathrooms to match.  They are all individually decorated with a very comfortable bed and bedding.  The kitchenette is very useful with a microwave, kettle, mini- hob and basin, as well as cutlery, crockery and saucepans.  The bathroom is well stocked with Clarins and Hermes products, which you are encouraged to take away (including a full bottle of Hermes perfume!) Breakfast is served until a very civilised 12:00 (and in your room at no extra charge).  All in all, we would thoroughly recommend this little place.  We don't all want to stay in large hotels; one might almost think some reviewers have an agenda!

Reviews.Title: “spoil yourself...you worth it!”
Reviews.Author: maximos e
Reviews.Content: the budget only allowed us to spend a day in this magnificent place!Spacious rooms, antique french decor, quality service, excellent staff! Unforgettable moments! merci! merci beaucoup Jays!ps.loved the Hermes toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “Weird...”
Reviews.Author: Kozlik700
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews. I was staying at a hotel which I love but, I thought I'd try this one out because it is number one and it was cheaper then where I was staying (which is rated like 100+). I had the hotel call (the concierge put it on speakerphone for me) and it was really odd. First they quoted 300 euros, then they quoted 420 euros then they said they might have a room (is it possible to 'possibly have a room?). They said there was a suite at 420 which was available but, probably not. C'mon guys either you have a room, or you don't ... who runs this place?

Reviews.Title: “Feel like a king !!! Splendid!!!”
Reviews.Author: brad t
Reviews.Content: Our experience in Jays was just absolutely fabulous, the moment we entered you feel like a king in the spacious room.Everything can be be organize for you. Wonderful staff, Good location, everything is made to feel you comfortable. My wife an d I will definitely come again and again and again...

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Efeden
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Jays for 3 nights with My husband and My 4 years old boy in December.The hotel was nice,the staff was friendly,the room was Well furnished,the service was perfect..the only negative thing I can say that there is No restaurant inside the hotel so there is No dinner.So the price seems a little bit expensive becouse of this handicap.But except this everything was fine so can say"highly recommended":)

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect 10!”
Reviews.Author: LATOTLV
Reviews.Content: In celebration of my 50th birthday, we stayed at Jays for one week this past December. Their warmth, hospitality, and knowledge of everything Paris was absolutely first rate. From a winding marble staircase up to our rooms, beautiful floral arrangements, antique French decor with all the modern conveniences available for our comfort, Hermes and Clarins toiletries and the gorgeous views of the streets of Paris from our windows, this hotel was a perfect 10! The staff had champagne for us each evening and wonderful coffee and croissants each morning. A beautiful fruit plate was also left in our rooms each day. Gourmet chocolates were placed on our beds each night. To top it off, they gave us beautiful Christmas gifts for the holiday! Judy and her entire staff were "at our ready" while respecting our privacy. I cannot think of a better place to celebrate a special occasion. I can't imagine staying anywhere else when I return to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing attention to detail!”
Reviews.Author: MardiAustralia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at Jays in October to celebrate our 35 th wedding anniversary. We are booking to return in May and cannot fault the rooms, location, service, facilities of Jays. The staff at Jays are amazing from the time you confirm your booking. We were emailed a comprehensive, current list of restaurant recommendations. They made bookings for us at the restaurants we chose and they were all very impressive restaurants. We felt as if we were staying in a luxury apartment and were not aware of other guests. Jays is truly a boutique hotel and is walking distance to the majority of desirable shopping and eating destinations and many sights.. We loved the nearby Saturday morning food market. The decor of our rooms was stunning and the room was very spacious (particularly for Paris). All toiletries, towels etc were top quality. We are looking forward to returning to Jays ASAP!

Reviews.Title: “Simply One of The BEST!”
Reviews.Author: Brett H
Reviews.Content: While my Fiance was on tour last year (which lends to us staying in budget hotels) we had 2 nights set aside for thanksgiving in Paris. We were booked at Jays Paris and from the second we stepped in, to the moment we reluctantly left for London we loved this hotel. The staff is the key, they are somehow always out of sight until you need them and then they become the perfect fix-it, concierge, or tour guide. The hotel will provide anything they possibly can to make your stay more comfortable... we were not able to think of anything even though we tried. Espresso every time we came in or out, a large room (very very rare in europe) and a bed I could have slept for days in had I not wanted to go take in all i could of paris and its culture. Bottom line this hotel is pricey... so it is not for everyone, the last thing you would want on a trip to Paris is to stretch yourself so thin on money for a room that you are eating McDonalds in a land of such fine wine and cuisine... however, if your budget allows not one penny, euro, pound, quid, yen, cordoba, peso...etc would be wasted on a stay at Jays.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!! Wonderful Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: FriendVacation
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Jays from November 1st thru 4th. We chose Jays because of other reviews we read. What a wonderful hotel and location. The owner and the staff can't do enough for you. They go out of their way to make sure everything is perfect from the decor to the nightly chocolate treat left on your pillow. Their restaurant recommendations were spot on. I highly recommend the breakfast. It is a great start to the day. The location can't be beat. It is a short walk to the metro and Paris sites. On our last evening at Jays we decided to stay in and what a remarkable experience we had. We ordered dinner from a local restaurant and Ivan went to pick it up for us. They turned the lounge into our own private dining room complete with white table service. It was the perfect ending to a perfect stay. Marlene S.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Paris - Jays made it a perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: SuebUK1967
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many good hotels around the world both large and small and we would say that Jays was one of the best! They offer the personal touch which is very rare, their attention to detail is fantastic. Before our trip I arranged many things for my partners birthday and Judy was very helpful from balloons in the room to dinner reservations, nothing was too much trouble. All the staff were amazing a lovely warm welcome on arrival and free drinks in the lounge when ever you came back from sight seeing they really do know how to look after their guests. The room was fantastic and the location wonderful just a short walk from all the major places you will want to go and see. I cannot fault this hotel and if you are thinking of staying with them you will not regret it as they will make your stay one to remember. Thank you to all the staff at Jays we hope to visit again soon! Sue & Jackie London

Reviews.Title: “High level service and rooms”
Reviews.Author: Corina2
Reviews.Content: Beautiful clean room and the staff makes you feel like a royal. I love to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: Sara D
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews here before booking, Jays had a lot to live up to - but it surpassed my expectations in every way. Every need I could have had was perfectly anticipated by the excellent staff, even down to the correct socket transformer in the room for my laptop and the weather forecast gently pushed under the door each morning - both unrequested but absolutely essential. I have never experienced quite such attention to detail in such a elegant way. There really is nothing I would change and plan to visit again next year, and the year after, and the one after that......!

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ily879
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful time at Jays.  The staff was so great and helpful, especially Michel.  He went above and beyond to make sure that we had a great time in Paris.  Our room was beautiful and the amenities were perfect.  We were there for our three year wedding anniversary and we greatly appreciated the anniversary surprises.  We will definitely return to Jays the next time we're in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: susan h
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend in paris staying at Jays. From the second we were collected by their driver at Gare du Nord we were looked after beautifully. The rooms were gorgeous the welcome was fantastic and the staff wonderful. I have never been anywhere before where the staff want to hear as to whether your day was good the restaurant they booked was enjoyable etc! I want to live here! I have already booked to return. The best place I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Special”
Reviews.Author: docGamba
Reviews.Content: I took my mother who is in her late 70's along with my daughter to Paris in November. I wanted something special, something that I will always remember and Jays was the perfect hotel. I knew that the room, accomdations would be great but I wanted the extras: help, assistance in finding the great resturants, and directions to attractions. The staff, well, I can't say enough...Edwin, this man is so attentive to every detail. If you're looking for a trip to Paris you won't forget, then this hotel property is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “As good as all say”
Reviews.Author: LunaJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed with the family during summer vacation. The way everyone at the hotel took care of us was fantastic. The attention to detail and the personalized service made us feel really comfortable and at home. Our daughters had their own connecting room, which was very nice, and we all looked forward to see what fruit would be in our rooms when we returned from our adventures outside. Since we visited in August many restaurants were closed, but the staff made great efforts at finding us good places to eat. A definite place we recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: 187514Gonzalo
Reviews.Content: What set Jays apart is the way they take care of you all the time; it has nothing to do with any other hotel we have been to, and it is hard to imagine a better service, perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best”
Reviews.Author: dissonj
Reviews.Content: WOW! What a place. Magnificent, large rooms with every possible convenience. And there is nothing that Judy and her staff won't do for you. My wife and I travel a lot and we were so happy with Jays.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Linda W
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris to celebrate my partner's birthday weekend and stayed for 2 nights at JAYS hotel on the Rue Copernic - minutes from L'Arc de Triomphe. The hotel was spectacular - the staff were absolutely faultless: friendly yet efficient and professional. Our suite was beautiful and the special treats (gorgeous toiletries and delicious chocolates), made the whole experience an unforgettable one. When we next return to Paris, we will return to JAYS hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Feel Like Royalty at Jays Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Patti S
Reviews.Content: From the second we stepped through the door, we were swept away by a whirlwind of beauty, exceptional service & contemporary French culture mixed with modern accents at it's finest. There are no words to describe how beautiful my room was & my plan is to return & spend the day relaxing in this special place. The breakfast was the perfect mix of healthy treats & there was not a thing we wanted for when needed. I will never stay in another hotel while in Paris! TRES Manifique!

Reviews.Title: “Great personal service”
Reviews.Author: sweetie111
Reviews.Content: We chose Jays because of the reviews on tripadvisor, and we were not disappointed. We met several members of staff during our stay and found them all to be excellant, especially Romain and Ivan - genuine friendly guys. Our room was wonderful, bed very comfortable. The lighting and mirrors in the bathroom were great for applying make up! On our next trip to Paris, we will definately be booking into Jays.

Reviews.Title: “A personal touch in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: HoratioT
Reviews.Content: We chose Jays because we have stayed in many of the larger-type, famous hotels in the world and wanted one that would give a little more of a personal touch for a 4-day trip. Trip Advisor was raving about it so that's how we came to book. The concierge Ivan was exceptional, as was Romain, and the little touches like fruit in rooms in the afternoon, complimentary champagne, wines and coffee in the lounge and the general welcome was excellent. We were a little disappointed with the rather sparse breakfast; a recommendation to Judy and her staff would be to consider some cheese and ham and perhaps fruit and granola to add variety. We appreciate that at 10 euros it represents good value in the centre of Paris, but I would have preferred to have been able to pay a little more and have a wider choice! Also, a few cans of lager in the foyer fridge would be less expensive for the hotel to provide than champagne and probably a popular option. We don't want to sound negative and have still given an 'excellent' rating because we would return and recommend it to friends

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Paris”
Reviews.Author: tajwilliams
Reviews.Content: We chose Jays because of the excellent reviews on tripadvisor. All I can say is that it totally lives up to the hype. We met several members of staff during our stay, and I can not fault the service. Nothing was too much trouble to ask. The room was gorgeous, with an incredibly comfortable bed and great bathroom. The goodies in the bathroom and complimentary chocolates in the room, all added to the overall wonderful stay. It is a great location for restaurants and tourist spots. I would highly recommmend Jays to anyone and if I ever come back to Paris wouldn't hesitate to choose Jays again.

Reviews.Title: “Just keeps getting better!”
Reviews.Author: PilotD
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Jays, and it did not disappoint. We had a lovely room, and as before the staff was absolutely wonderful. From great restaurant recommendations to directions to the sights, it was clear that everyone at Jays takes a personal interest in making sure your trip is truly memorable. We highly recommend Jays to anyone looking for small hotel charm in a great section of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Jays Paris Best Service in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: SkateCouple
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiance spent the two days at Jays Paris and absolutely loved it! The service is top notch, and the rooms are both spacious and have a wonderful history, featuring antiques from French history. We never slept so well and having breakfast bed was a real treat. We definitely give Jays a 5 star rating! It's really a great hotel if you are looking for a quiet location that is also very close to all attractions. Quick tip for Paris: It's just as fast as any taxi and far cheaper to get around town between Jays and pretty much anywhere using the Metro trains.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: paolacohen
Reviews.Content: It is so hard to find a nice size room and when you add incredible service you have a winner. we spent two days at The Jay's in Paris and we recommend this hotel to everyone who is looking to stay in a very special place and receive unbelievable service. Judy give every guest so much attention you feel you are staying at your best friend home We loved it Clean and comfortable beds plus os much little gifts we just felt so welcome here Paola Cohen

Reviews.Title: “Jays made Paris Perfect”
Reviews.Author: barbara r
Reviews.Content: Our stay was 5 nights in Paris and we could not have asked for a more perfect, friendly, pristine, and accommodating hotel. The staff was so extraordinary that we have never found any place quite like it where each person we met was nicer than the one before. From Jane (our tour guide), concierges Philippe,Ivan and Roman, to Edwin (housekeeping) there was a thread of consistency in all these individuals that is carefully chosen by Judy (the owner). The staff really enjoys their work and have you as a guest as their first priority. There was nothing that we ever lacked or were disappointed in. When reading reviews I know it is sometimes difficult to decipher who has similar likes and dislikes to you, but at Jays it doesn't matter. They tailor their service to the individual. I have read the other reviews of this hotel and want to make note that some of what others have not liked were really not Jays fault at all. Please be discerning when evaluating your decision to stay/not stay here on some of the negatives you read. We have stayed here and would not stay ANYWHERE ELSE in Paris. Every night as we entered that beautiful French blue door we could feel ourselves relax into the comfort of home. We are so happy we discovered Jays and so happy to impart this to you.

Reviews.Title: “Jays is luxe but service uneven”
Reviews.Author: DRV25
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at Jays in August 2011. Our room was spectacular, and we loved Ivan (concierge) although other concierges were quite average. The location in the 16th Arr. was perfect. I was really unhappy that Jay's website had recommended, and offered to arrange, appointments at a nearby hair salon (Lucie St Claire). My 10 year old daughter wanted a haircut as her special treat. The appointment was scheduled by the concierge, the stylist was great, and then they overcharged me by 18 Euros. As all conversations were in French I didn't feel comfortable arguing with them, but I later checked their rates & let the concierge know about the overcharge. Judy (who has her hair styled there) also spoke with the salon manager. I was disappointed that neither the salon nor the hotel would correct the overcharge - even though our total bill at the hotel was around 3,000 Euros. It may seem like a silly little thing but this wasn't right.

Reviews.Title: “Trip in Paris”
Reviews.Author: P R
Reviews.Content: Top notch hotel for a wonderful week in Paris ! Not only the rooms were the cosiest I've seen, but the food was fabulous as well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection has it's price”
Reviews.Author: HankF99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights late August 2011 with wife and two kids (ages 9 and 10). The location is sensational, residential area very pretty yet close enough to walk to everything. Taxi drivers all know the street. The property is beautiful and pristine, like staying with royalty. Room was large, well air conditioned, with great bed and shower, even free wifi in the room. Kids got a connecting room. Breakfast room and lobby similarly nice. But it is the service that makes Jay's what it is. They make you feel like a celebrity in a very warm and friendly way. Split of champagne for the room after dinner? Breakfast and shower after redeye before room is ready? Dinner rez? They take care of everything and do it in a comfortable way. The price is simply outrageous. Yet, I'd do it again!

Reviews.Title: “Can't say anything bad about this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Irene S
Reviews.Content: One of the greatest experiences of my life was staying at Jays. Wow they sure know how to treat a person. Yeah it was a bit pricey, but who cares when you get to stay in such a beautiful room in such a romantic city!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Make your trip to Paris even more wonderful - stay at Jays!”
Reviews.Author: GDauphinee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had been to Paris twice in the past but this was our first trip with our children (ages 8 & 9). My sister booked the four of us, as well as herself, in three of the five rooms at Jays (we took up the second floor) after reading all of the great reviews on TripAdvisor. We actually spent six days in Paris in the middle of a two-week vacation in London so our exposure to Jays started with the transportation they arranged from the train station (quick and easy). The first thing you notice after passing through the bright blue door, is the great aroma and the beautiful orchids. Check-in was painless and the rooms exquisite. We had a connecting room with our girls and their bed was covered with stuffed bears. There were so many personal touches in the rooms (by Judy) including framed "letters" from the room/furniture/bears giving you their history. The bathroom amenities were all by Clarins and Hermes; after one shower, I smelled as good as the hotel. The bedding was luxurious and we slept like rocks all week. There was a well-appointed kitchenette in each room although we took advantage of their exceptional breakfast every morning before setting out. Judy does just a fantastic job of running this hotel and she told me, on our last day, that she doesn't hire any staff that she personally doesn't enjoy. It was obvious. Every single member of the staff was pleasant, helpful (running off to make "inquiries" and print maps at the drop of a hat) and spoke fluent English (a real plus since the years have been unkind to my memory of high school French). I can't make enough positive comments about our stay at Jays and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone! Thank you to Judy and all.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Ben_Claire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Jays for a very special occasion in early June - was simply fantastic! Brilliant personalised service, great recommendations and the most amazing room. We would thoroughly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Jaiette
Reviews.Content: Really great hotel. Incredibly friendly staff who all speak English very well. The restaurant recommendation at Jamin was superb. And as a bonus... full bottle of Hermes perfume in the bathroom to keep. Score!

Reviews.Title: “Best service we have experienced”
Reviews.Author: jjmitch1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have traveled to Europe a number of times and have stayed in many hotels - both large and small. In all of our travels we have never experienced such consideration and thoughtfulness from the hotel staff. Hotel is probably the wrong word, as Jays only has a small number of rooms and suites. Because of its size, the staff can remain focused on the desires and needs of each of the guests. We felt as if we had our own personal staff throughout our stay, and the staff offered recommendations for activities and dining, and guided us through or scheduled transportation and reservations for us. Overall, a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Like having your own apartment in Paris”
Reviews.Author: LAW64
Reviews.Content: We were nervous about booking a family trip to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary solely on the basis of trip advisor recommendations. However we had a lovely time at Jays and in Paris. Although we were suprised to find that our room choices had been changed when we arrived at the hotel it turned out that Jays had decided to give us one of the salons as an extra bedroom for our family of 5. This meant that we had 3 double inter-connecting bedrooms and two bathrooms along with a kitchennette and computer. As the rooms are spacious it felt like a large apartment and everyone was happy. Although the total price was expensive it was for a special occasion and what you are paying for is the special level of personal service. We were very well looked after with restaurant and hotel bookings, driver from train station and lots of lovely treats each day including Clarins toiletries and Fauchon products. I would agree with other reviewers that breakfast should be included and that some additional items could be offered for breakfast including yogurt and fruit. However in Paris you end up eating a lot of food so maybe it is not such a bad thing to start the day with a light breakfast. The location is not central so you need to use taxis or the metro to get to many of the sights. (if you call a taxi to the hotel they charge from the time they start to come to the hotel!) However the rooms are very quiet and the beds are excellent so you get a good nights sleep which is not always the case in a city hotel. Overall we had a great stay and would recommend the hotel to larger families celebrating a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Leave it all in their capable hands!”
Reviews.Author: JCMJapan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 5 nights at Jay's Paris in July 2011. It was simply amazing. I read about Jay's Paris in tripadvisor review,I had the great expectations. Our experience for this hotel is far beyond,much better than I imagined. Almost every reviewer mentioned,the hotel is so clean and beautiful, rooms are spacious( you have a huge closet ), and have well working air-conditioning. Those advantages the reviewer said are quite right,and deserve the high reputations. I want to emphasize two more great points this hotel has. 1;Location It's a short walking distance to Arc de triomphe de l'Etoile. You have Metro 1 line there. It runs along Seine liver,where you can cover the most famous sightseeing places. And that line has many correspondence,so you can easily get where you want to go. If you walk down southward along Avenue Kleber,5-10min walk will bring you Trocadero. In there you can have beautiful view of Effel tower,and you can rest at busy but cozy cafe. In another direction,you can find Avenue Victor Hugo. It's a beautiful street where you'll find something you like. Those places are chic and quiet,very much like in Paris atmosphere. It's not so crowded / touristic as say,Louvre or Opera. 2;Hotel staffs As soon as you book Jays,they send you the detailed information about the Hotel itself and the restaurants they recommend. And by e-mail,you can get what you want. Say,the reservations for the restaurants,the opera tickets,the museum passes before you arrive Paris. They are really skillful and talented, The most importantly,they are deal with your requests with pleasure.While you're in this Hotel,a few steps down from your room,they are always waiting for you to answer to your tiny concerns,and ready to serve you a cup of coffee with smiles. I just think that such kindnesses are rarely seen in the touristic city like Paris. It's a great relief for the tourists,especially for the Paris first timer like us. In conclusion,this small hotel deserves 5-stars or far more. You have nothing to worry,just book Jay's Paris and leave it all in their capable hands!

Reviews.Title: “Superb. A hidden gem in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: miroheart
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, above and beyond what we expected. After reading all the recommendations for the Jays on Tripadvisor we decided to make a booking. Wow! What a beautiful hotel. The rooms are large by any standards and so beautifully decorated. They are themed in a very elegant Parisian way. We stayed in the Louis XVI room and our children in the adjoining Empire room (I should mention the teddy bears all over the beds that greeted the kids making their welcome extra wonderful). The Arc de Triomphe is 5 mins away while the Tour Eiffel is a 15 min walk. Both rooms have kitchenettes (elegantly hidden away behind cupboard doors), always a bonus when traveling with kids. Both bathrooms are large, ours with a deep bath for relaxation. The best thing about the Jays is the staff. They are so attentive and give the most exceptional service we have experienced. We would come back and stay at the Jays in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A DREAM COME TRUE”
Reviews.Author: Day22B
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Jays for 5 nights during June 2011. We would highly recommend Jays Paris - it truely was fabulous and a dream come true. My partner arranged to stay here as a surprise. The first i knew of it was when a smartly dressed young man was waiting at the airport pickup gate with a sign saying my name and Jays hotel. We were then driven to the hotel in a lovely car. On arrival at the hotel we were provided with a complimentary glass of champagne and all the staff were introduced to us - they were all so friendly and informative. The staff at Jays made sure our stay at the hotel and Paris was everything (and more) than we hoped for. We stayed in the Providence suite and the decor in this room is truely gorgeous. The room had everything we needed in it including a cook top and the bathroom had a decent sized bath in it - which is a luxury in a Paris hotel. The beautiful toiletries provided in the bathroom also need a mention and we had lovely robes provided in the bathroom. Each day the room was cleaned and we were provided with fresh fruit platters and chocolates on the bed - the finishing touches in the hotel are outstanding. Jays has stunning flowers located throughout the hotel and they are beautiful. The staff at Jays were delightful, informative and genuinely wanted to assist to ensure our stay was as good as it could be. The staff provided us with tickets to the louvre so we didn't have to line up to get tickets. The location of Jays is outstanding we walked to the arc de triomphe in 3 mins the eiffel tower in10 minutes and the louvre was a nice walk away. Jays is surrounded by an abundance of restaurants, cafes and bakeries so we were spoilt with choice of where to eat. We would like to thank Judy and all the Staff at Jays for their assistance whilst we stayed at Jays and would especially like to thank them for sharing a very special evening with us - one which we will never forget! We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and look forward to returning (maybe for our honeymoon!).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff and personal service!”
Reviews.Author: Tiabsn
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time! Jays Paris was perfect for our family. Almost too much so. When my son saw the computer with internet access in his room, it was difficult to get him to leave to see beautiful Paris! Judy and her entire staff were amazing and took wonderful care of us all. Our room was picture perfect every evening when we returned from a long day of sight seeing. We also loved those amazing chocolates and fresh fruit every day. It inspired me upon my return home, I went to our local market and filled our house with fruit. My daughter said our bed was like a floating cloud that you did not fall through. I agree!

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel but rather a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: richfromreynolds
Reviews.Content: We choose Jays for our first trip to Paris largely based on the superior reviews by other travelers.Jays fully met the lofty expectations set by these reviews. The hotel is on a side street off Keibler Avenue. It has a small entranceway which properly reflects the tone of the hotel - quiet and tastefully elegant. The rooms are very spacious and impeccably maintained. Throught our 6 night stay, the staff was attentive beyond belief. You can't arrive or leave without being met by them, asking if you need any assistance and inquiring about your experiences (whether it be dinner, locations visited, etc.) Fresh fruit in the room every afternnon (bought by Judy at the local market), complimentary champagne or wine to relax before dinner were part of our daily routine that gave that "home" feeling. Before we arrived, numerous email exchanges allowed us to set up a variety of dinner reservations based on their recommendations. We were exposed to a wide variety of experiences from "name" locations like Taillevant to fish restaurants frequently primarily by locals. You can absolutely rely on their recommendations. They also arranged a personal tour guide (Jane) who is excellent at seeing the personal side of Paris as well as the traditional sites. Finally, the location is ideal. It is a short walk to many restaurants, shopping and famous sites like the Arc de Triumpe and Eiffer Tower. It is a few minutes to the metro lines which is a convenient way to get around the city. It is the only place that we will choose to stay on our future visits to Paris. While you certainly can find nice Paris hotels for lower prices, we don't think you can find a better value when you consider the comfort of your room and the personal attention and concierge services that you receive.

Reviews.Title: “We said we'd come back... and we did”
Reviews.Author: L&JinVA
Reviews.Content: We first went to Jays in the summer of 2009. It was such a special trip that we decided to go back to in November 2010 for 4 nights to experience a different season. Jays was the only hotel we considered. As before, we arranged to have the hotel's driver pick us up at the airport and take us directly to the hotel. After a transatlantic flight that lands at 6:30 am, it is a relief not to have to think about getting a taxi or which train to take to get to the hotel. The check-in process was the same. Painless, over coffee. Since it was cold and rainy our entire trip, we spent more time in the hotel than last time. For this trip, we stayed in the Suite Fantasie. I am always pleased when the room looks exactly as it does on the website. For those that do a lot of travelling, it is usually the exception rather than the rule. For Paris, the rooms at Jays are large, but sill remain cozy. The suite had a discrete hidden kitchenette. Like before, the bathroom had robes, a towel warmer (especially appreciated during our chilly stay), the Clarins products, and now, a really nice bottle of Hermes perfume - a really understated scent, that I loved and wore throughout my trip instead of the fragrance I brought with me. In hindsight, I should've taken it with me when I left since I now can't find it, but I didn't want to feel greedy. :-) They made reservations for us for a couple of resturants from their extensive book of recommended restaurants. They were very interested in knowing our level of satisfaction with the service and meals at these restaurants to make sure they can continue to recommend them to other guests. While many of the staff were different, the hospitality was not. Everyone who works at the hotel is genuinely interested in ensuring you have an unbelievable stay in Paris. They are interested in knowing what you have planned for the day and how you enjoyed it afterwards. This personal service and attention to each guest is what sets Jays apart from other hotels and what they do best.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for our first trip to Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Kelmoc
Reviews.Content: Although I have never posted a review on any of my previous hotel stays, I felt I needed to post one for The Jays. My 9 year old daughter and I stayed there at the end of April and I don't think either of us could be more satisfied and appreciative of how wonderful the hotel was and how well we were treated by the staff. The amazing customer service started way before our trip. Judy and Ivan (and Philippe when we arrived) helped secure reservations to restaurants (including a few 3 star Michelin), the opera, lunches, monument and museum pass, a driver for airport pick-up and drop-off, and so much more. Judy was able to do this all on only a few weeks’ notice, due to my procratination. We arrived at the hotel from overseas at about 4pm and the staff had all of our clothes pressed by the time we went to Guy Savoy's at 8:45pm. The hotel is small, beautiful, impeccably kept and perfectly matched for Paris. The suite (Art Deco) was spacious and had wonderful artistic touches throughout. The bathroom was modern, large and fully accommodating. Yes, it is true; they do have towel warmers in the bathrooms. We were connected to the Salon, so computer access and kitchen/lounge amenities were readily accessible. When we needed a taxi, the staff had one ready for us. When my daughter wanted her hair done in Paris, the staff got us in at Lucie Saint -Clair (twice). When we were starving after coming back from the 3 hour opera Tosca at 11:30pm, the hotel had some nice snacks for us AND Ivan personally took us to a local store for a more hearty meal that Michelle helped us prepare when we returned. Ivan did this even though he was technically off work. Personally, the best part of my stay was the interaction with the hotel staff. I absolutely loved the late night conversations with Michelle, Charles and Ivan. I truly appreciated how patient they were with my pitiful attempts at French, my interest in speaking on a variety of subjects that may have been a bit mundane for Paris natives, and their overall enthusiasm regarding all things relating to my daughter or me. For those who need it, all the staff spoke fluent English. I am sorry to make the review so long, but The Jays was an integral part of making my first trip to Paris (and my father/daughter bonding trip) absolutely perfect. I will stay there each time I am in Paris and I have recommended it to anyone here in California that will listen. By the time we left, the staff honestly felt like family/friends. It is a one of a kind place!

Reviews.Title: “Jay's is my new home away from home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: LisaKnoxville
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two different times during a trip to France, once with my daughter and once with my husband. The location is perfect, service is stellar, and the rooms are lovely. It is hard to add to what the other reviewers said except that I agree it is a real find. The only issue I had was that they don't have a good system in place if you want to leave the staff an extra tip. And they deserve it.

Reviews.Title: “We had to come back. Even better the second time. Can't wait to come back again.”
Reviews.Author: Ghostofgaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Jays approximately six months ago and had to come back. The first time was a quick trip while we were in London last Summer. This time we planned a longer stay and thought we could see more of Paris. We, meaning me, my wife, and two children, ages 10 and 6. It is a small hotel, kids need to be on best behavior if traveling as a family. We wanted to again experience Paris away from the big hotels and crowds and Jays fits the bill. Travel enough and all the big hotels start to look the same no matter where you are. The personal touch of such a small hotel like Jays is something very special. When I say small, that only has to do with the number of rooms, not the size of the rooms. We had two adjoining suites and more than ample space for the four of us. Each suite was well appointed and decorated to make you feel you were staying in your fine Paris apartment rather than a hotel. The bathrooms in our suites were large as well. The common areas were spacious quiet and relaxing, also well decorated. The free wifi was an added benefit. If you are considering going to Paris for a short or long trip, what are you waiting for? Go! The first time we went we were a little intimidated about navigating the city as first-timers and with kids in tow. Jays made the city accessible to us. The second time the staff at Jays were at the ready to help us explore and discover more of this wonderful city. From Jay's location it is all right there for you. Walk to great restaurants, shops, sites, through interesting neighborhoods, and the local restaurants are not tourist traps. These are mostly small restaurants where Parisians from the neighborhoods surrounding Jays are dining. Slow down, emphasize your good manners, attempt to speak some French, and you will be welcomed around Paris. For the experience we were trying to get from our trip to Paris, the value was excellent. If you are looking for big hotels with 200+ rooms, four restaurants under roof, a huge gym, a pool, tour bus stops at the foot of the hotel, Jays is not for you, but if you are looking for small boutique hotel that can get you away from the crowds and allow for you to slow life down and enjoy Paris from within a neighborhood, Jays is for you. If you have not been to Paris before and are thinking about it, you can do this. Go to Paris. You will not be disappointed. Enjoy! Thank you to Judy and the staff at Jays for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Pied-a-Terre”
Reviews.Author: lidipiri
Reviews.Content: Was there in September of 2010 and still remember it so fondly that was prompted to write a review even after so many months... that should say something about the hotel! It truly is a home away from home. The perfect place to feel as if you own your own place in Paris without any of the hassles. The boutique hotel (and I would equate it more to a luxurious bed & breakfast) is not that easy to identify -no signs, just a small plaque at the entrance. How lovely. We had been in Paris at another hotel (not a very good one), then went to Brugges, then to Amsterdam to two amazing hotels so wanted our last night in Paris to be extraordinary. We took a suite that faced the street. Something magical about opening "your" windows in a robe provided by the hotel to a balcony filled with flowers, while across the street there is an older woman watering her flowers waving a bonjour out to you. You feel at home immediately. Check-in is done in the lobby/living room as you sip un noisette (expresso with a dash of milk) or surf the internet. (Only complaint I have is that once in the room they were having wireless problems and I was not able to connect in the room at all.) Pampering is unobtrusive (chocolates and fruit awaiting in the room.) Then a cold small bottle of champagne delivered to our door. Judy, the proprietress is delightful and helpful. May I suggest that if you are not familiar with Paris to contact her first - she knows her city well. We were not in the room much... Paris at our private door entrance awaited for us to bid it farewell, but if there was ever a place that could have kept me inside, it would have been this one. It was the perfect place to end our visit to France! When we return The Jays will have us on its front step.

Reviews.Title: “The best kept secret among Paris boutique hotels”
Reviews.Author: JKRIsrael
Reviews.Content: The Jays was undoubtedly a big surprise! The Hotel turned out to be the Jewel of the crown in this trip, and since our return, I am "marketing" the hotel to all our acquaintances, telling them that this is one of Paris best secrets. The meticulous attention for details was highly appreciated (Cashmere smuggler...) The setup, the personal touch in every corner, the attire of the suite and the public spaces were delightful and just "right". The restaurants album is a masterpiece, and above all - the service, the attitude, the attention and recommendations were suburb. We are "heavy travellers" so we can spot and appreciate true quality immediately. The Jays was far and above our expectations, and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Bargoodfood
Reviews.Content: This is the absolute best hotel in Paris. I have no doubt. You will not find better staff. The location is great. They treat you like family. My small kids love the owner!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, memorable experience”
Reviews.Author: gotojays
Reviews.Content: I planned a trip to Paris and London for my granddaughters graduation from High School,accompanied by her mother. Since it was to be a surprise, there were many emails going back and forth between me and the fantastic owner and staff, to make this a dream experience. Jays came through on every level with high marks. Beautiful room, luxury bath details, bowls of fruit and other goodies always in the room. Central location near the Champs de Elysse with a view of the Eiffel at one end and the Arch de Triomph at the other, with great shopping inbetween. Jays provided a marvelous list of restaurants nearby that they had tested personally. Helpful directions were always given. They provide transportation to and from airports and rail. Tea and champagne always offered in their lovely gathering room....I could go on and on, but in summation, my girls arrived home glowing with happiness and raving about Jays, who thoughtfully sent me pictures they had taken of them. Our family will return to Jays.

Reviews.Title: “Dire value for money”
Reviews.Author: Pugly72
Reviews.Content: Sorry to be the party pooper on this one - top of trip advisor pops in Paris - but if you are spending €440 per night you have the right to expect something very special. The idea is good - a boutique hotel of just 5 rooms - with a blend of interesting contemporary decor and some antiques, good sized bedrooms and a promise of excellent and personal service. But the promise was far from fulfilled. It looked good when we arrived. A pleasant seemingly helpful 30 something guy checked us in over a complimentary drink, giving us the low down on the hotel and with a few tips about the locality and then showed us to the room. Our suite was a good size yes but nothing very special. No view from our room - just a flat internal roof with some plants and a skylight over the manager's office. It was a cold January weekend but the air-conditioning / heating didn't work properly and wouldn't climb above 19.5C. The management (consisting it seems of two identikit male managers - each doing 12 hour shifts. We saw no other staff during our 2 day stay) couldn't sort it out and in the end had to give us a portable heater on the second night. The TV system was the most 'unuser-friendly' system I have come across. It was consistently locking off and we had to call the management up six times during our stay to put it right. In the end the day manager gave up trying with a polite but typical gallic shrug. We came down for breakfast after our first night only to be told that it wasn't available as we should have ordered it before 7pm the previous evening. Perhaps our helpful check-in manager was not so helpful after all. Many apologies were then forthcoming but no breakfast! That evening we were reminded three times to order breakfast so the embarassment would not be repeated. So we did order. What was on our plates the next morning was the simplest of simple continental breakfasts - baguette, croissant, fresh juice and coffee / tea, Fine. But very much a 2 star petit dejeuner in a four star hotel. (And not included in the €440 per night charge). When we checked out we asked Day Manager to order a taxi to Gare du Nord. He do so and a few minutes later was helping us and our baggage into the car. As we got in he said to the taxi driver 'Charles de Gaulle, s'il vous plait.' Fortunately I overheard him and put the driver right. Quite sure it was a genuine mistake... anyone could have made it, couldn't they?! Jays - ok at €200 per night perhaps. But €440 - you've got to be joking. Has the Trip Advisor Number 1 status gone to their heads. Interestingly, only one other room was occupied during our weekend stay.

Reviews.Title: “Business trip made to feel like a vacation at Jays Paris”
Reviews.Author: LaurenW2011
Reviews.Content: As we all know, traveling to a foreign country can be both exciting and intimidating, especially when you're unfamiliar with the area, the language, AND more so when intertwined with business intricacy... I was introduced to JAYS Paris from a family friend. Although I was a bit nervous about traveling to Paris for the first time, my hesitations and nervousness quickly evaporated when my chauffeur picked me up with a smile and helped with my luggage at the train station. JAYS Paris is conveniently located within walking distance to a variety of amazing restaurants, tourist attractions, and shopping. The staff is warm, welcoming, organized, and professional. They helped me plan my trip from the beginning to the end. They booked my transportation needs, dining reservations, as well as my sightseeing trip on Saturday. They also printed all my reservation confirmations in English so that I would have all the information with me. I was able to take advantage of the hotel’s wireless connection and computer stations to prepare for my meeting and business activities. All of the rooms are spacious, relaxing, and beautifully decorated. The lobby/lounge also makes the perfect setting to host meetings, and entertain clients, with the lovely service of coffee, refreshments, and champagne. I truly enjoyed my time at JAYS and have recommended this unique gem to my friends and business associates.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like Royalty!”
Reviews.Author: Boomer62
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris, After looking for a suitable hotel on the web, I chose Jays as our hotel based on reviews I had read on the Trip Adviser website. Also the location was perfect, given that we had such a short amount of time in Paris (3 days) it was well suited for all the venues we wanted to visit. The hotel is perfect in everyway, just like all of the reviews say, I have to admit I was a bit skeptical, but can say beyond a shadow of a doubt that this truly is a wonderful hotel. It all began with an initial consultation over e-mail, they were able to ascertain our requirements and make recommendations based on the short amount of time we had and exactly what we wanted out of our visit. They booked everything from our transport to and from the train station to all of our lunch, and dinner reservations, as well we were able to get tickets to the Louvre and other attractions which was very convenient. After speaking with Judy via e-mail she suggested that we hire the hotels recommended tour guide Jane, given we had such limited time in Paris it was the best option for us. Jane was superb, she took us to all the main attractions, knew all the bus and Metro lines which was huge given we had such precious time. She is very knowlegable on Paris, the history, all the venues we visited etc. She was well worth the small price we paid, she even recommended how we should arrange the rest of our visit, where to go, and how to get there, thus helping us maximise our time, absolutely a fantastic service. The great thing about Jays is it's central location, it is walking distance to the Arc de Triomphe, Trocadero and Eiffel Tower. Phillipe and Ivan are most helpful with directions and maps, they were great to speak with in the mornings and evenings after we returned from the days adventures. The rooms are well appointed with all the amenities and well decorated. They include in room safe, Sat TV, king bed, WiFi, mini bar fridge, iron and ironing board. The staff had a variety of fresh fruit waiting in our room each afternoon when we returned from a day of sightseeing. There is really nothing that we did not like about our stay at Jays, Judy and the staff were awesome and made our stay the best it could possibly be. We will return again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Superb ! Manifique !”
Reviews.Author: Lynn4461
Reviews.Content: As seasoned business and leisure travellers we were cautious about staying at Jays despite the glowing reviews as it was a special occassion. All I can say is that this has to be one of the best city hotels we have ever satyed in and our concerns melted away as soon as we were greeted by the fabulous staff. The suite was just wonderful, outstriped our expectations and the piece and quiet in such a central location was perfect. The staff are spot on - they and attentive, knowledgable and helpful if you need them, but equally unobtrusive if you don't. The location couldn't be better, a few minutes walk from the main attractions. There are plenty of good restaurants and bars near by which are well worth a visit - Jays gives a very comprehensive guide to some of the best. Would we recommend this wonderful oasis and stay again ? Too right we would - go on treat yourself ! !

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL hotel. I will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: jo28352
Reviews.Content: JAYS lives up to its reviews. My stay there was everything that I expected and more. The location was central for sightseeing, I was able to walk nearly anywhere I that wanted to go. Lots of restaurants and shops in the area. The staff members were extremely helpful and friendly. The entire hotel was clean, welcoming and well cared for. They went above and beyond to ensure my stay was a pleasant one. I was sad to leave, as I knew the next hotel on my journey would not live up to JAYS standards. I will definitely return!!!

Reviews.Title: “my favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: terilynhou
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at Jays. The first was with my husband. He did all the research as he always wants to find "the best". We were so happy with the room (huge, bright,beautiful and so quiet) and the care and attention we received. I am a terrible sleeper but Jays covered all the bases: quiet but cool A/C, super bed, huge windows that can be totally dark at night. All of our activities/guides were booked before we arrived. We walked everywhere. Judy's restaurant choices were great. The second visit was this last Dec. with my adult daughter. I had no qualms traveling without hubby because I knew we would be met at the train and everything would be taken care of. My daughter wanted to shop and see art, and the lights of the city at night. Judy arranged a shopping excursion with an English speaking guide from the Christmas market, to the flea markets for antiques, and to Montmartre. It was a trip my daugher and I will always remember! It was like staying in a grand home with your closest friends. Until next time...

Reviews.Title: “Why stay any where else?”
Reviews.Author: scienceprof2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a rare gem that believes in pampering the guest and making sure the guest feels like the most important person in the world. The hotel is small and beautifully appointed. The rooms are all decorated in the best taste - they are graceful, elegant and very comfortable. We love turning into the foyer and knowing "we are coming home at the end of a great day in Paris." Before arriving, we received an email that gave us dining suggestions, help with transportation, and a list of the additional services provided by the staff at the hotel. By the time we arrived in Paris, we had transportation, dining reservations, and tickets for the museum we wanted to visit. It is wonderful to have all those details handled efficiently because it made our trip much more enjoyable. Not only that, but the staff was always ready to provide additional help at all times. We really cannot say enough nice things about the stay - and the hotel deserves all praise. Our only concern is that others will "discover" this fabulous hotel and it will become everyone's favorite place in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ayalax
Reviews.Content: Jays is in a good location about eight minutes walk the Trocadero. We stayed in the Asia suite which was very nicely furnished and included a Miele induction hob and microwave. The room was very spacious , quiet and comfortable. Computer access is available, the air conditioning works really well and laundry is done in-house. Dry cleaning can take up to two days . Freshly cut fruit was provided every day and the staff were extremely helpful. There are lots of choices of restaurants close by as well. The only possible quibbles are that there are a lot of stairs to the reception area and to the rooms and that television channels for English speaking guests is restricted. We will definitely stay at Jays on our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST.”
Reviews.Author: BenjaminCox
Reviews.Content: The only negative thing about our stay at this hotel was that we only stayed one night. Everything about 'Jays' is just perfect. From the moment we walked in the staff were always helpful and incredibly friendly. The rooms are all decorated in their own unique style each as beautiful and tasteful as the next. If you are looking for a romantic and personal hotel this is without doubt a must. I look forward to returning one day very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: GemmaAshley
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively for work and stay in so many hotels. The Jays is a stand out in every category.I cant tell you how impressed we were. Judy, the owner and designer of this hotel has hospitality perfected. The decor in the rooms is just to die for. We stayed in the Provence Suite and I have never seen a more beautiful room. The house keeper (I feel bad that I forgot his name) was just a delight and so helpful in every way. There are not enough good things to say. I will however mention that all the products in the bathroom are CLARINS which for me was just the best! I am already planning another trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: HongKongKoala1
Reviews.Content: A big thank you to all the staff at this hotel - you have paid attention to every detail to make sure your guests have a great time. We were travelling with a young child, and she was so happy with the different toys on her bed every night we came back to the hotel. The room is very beautiful and comfortable with real antiques, and the kitchnette is a nice touch. The location is central and is in walking distance to shopping and other amenities. But the most welcoming thing is the people at the hotel - very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel for comfort, service and friendly staff leading to a very memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: mf4sydney
Reviews.Content: Jays is perfect! This hotel is centrally located within walking distance of many main tourist attractions, wonderful shopping areas and great food/dining options. The rooms are stunning, beautifully furnished/decorated and also roomy. The bathroom was very clean and always filled with luxury toiletries. Above all, the staff were unbelievable catering to our every need and want. They arranged our dinner bookings, event bookings and even our future travel plans. They were always extremely friendly and helpful. Jays is not only a hotel but an experience you will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JStravellers99
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first trip to Paris. We had researched hotels on the internet and had chosen Jays because it was ranked #1 by Trip Advisor. Even after reading all the stupendous reviews, we were a bit cautious. Could any hotel be that good! YES!!! From the moment we checked in to the moment we leaved, the staff and owner of the hotel were at our service. They truly enjoy what they do and they made every effort to make us feel comfortable and at home. Every time we entered the hotel, we were greeted as if we were guests arriving in a private home. The hotel is well located and there are many good restaurants and cafes within walking distance..

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate”
Reviews.Author: Ojza
Reviews.Content: Everything is immaculate about this hotel. It was a great experience. I should have written this review long time ago as we were there back in September. But better late than never. They go that extra step which makes difference. Many thanks Judy and all other guys for warm hospitality. Would happily stay again next visit to Paris. Absolutely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “ONE WORD - FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: Teepsholland
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a fabulous 2 nights at Jays. Not only is it a great location, it is a beautiful hotel and the attention to detail is superb. The service is excellent and they were able to give fabulous recommendatons. The bathroom has Clarins toiletries and the decor is wonderful! They were very welcoming to our 2 young children too! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!

Reviews.Title: “It was practically perfect.”
Reviews.Author: rab28
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for one night and while not inexpensive it was worth every euro. It is not a luxury hotel in appearance perhaps a bit too modern for some but quite comfortable and what's not to love with a Picasso drawing on the wall and coffee or champagne in the afternoon. What stands out about Jays Paris is not only the size of the rooms but the level of care and attention expended on your stay. They know who you are when you walk in and they never stop trying to make your visit a positive one. We were there during the strike and the wonderful concierage on duty had 2 phones up to his ears, his cellphone and he was running out to the street to find us a taxi. We were never just another guest. All the touches are there to make you feel special and the wonderful staff are the icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently fabulous”
Reviews.Author: MarieSJC
Reviews.Content: Whether it's your first time to Paris or you're a regular visitor, Jays Hotel has consistently held the #1 position on Trip Advisor. This should entice you to email the hotel for any special pricing when you're planning on visiting Paris. We have stayed 3 years in a row, and each time we're continued to be amazed by the service of the staff, the impeccable cleanliness and size of the suites, and the overall elegance of the small neighborhood. The location is ideal, surrounded by the Eiffel Tower, Arc de Triomphe, and Champs Elysee. We will continue to visit Jays Hotel on our visits to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Service”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTwinMommy
Reviews.Content: The reviews are completely true. The hotel is decorated lovely, the rooms are HUGE by Paris standards and the location could not be better. I must say it was the service that blew us away. They truly went above and beyond to insure that every need was taken care of. I would highly recommend the hotel to anyone! We look forward to staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Jays in Paris”
Reviews.Author: skell10
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to Jays for a surprise special birthday in August and it was worth every penny. A fabulous hotel in every way, location, professional but unstuffy and attentive staff helped make this a most memorable visit. This is a chic boutique hotel that feels just like home. We will be back.......someday... don't know when, but I know we will meet again one sunny day...

Reviews.Title: “Jays is the Real Deal”
Reviews.Author: dancetictoc
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at Jays Sept.2 thru 5. Celebrated our 40th wedding anniversary before embarking on a 14 day River cruise of France. What a way to start our trip. We had the smallest room but it was very comfortable and romantic with the 2 big windows that overlook the potted geraniums and a typical Paris street scene. Judy and Staff were most accomodating giving advice, directions and just about anything to help. They arranged a driver to pick us up at the airport which made the transition to Paris seemless. They also arranged taxi service to the Quai where the river boat was docked. The only complaint was something uncontrollable when their neighbors decided to do some construction at 9 am when we wanted to sleep. The breakfast (extra charge) was typical french (croissants, juice coffee tea) but quite enough. We really enjoyed our time at Jays. It was a great way to start our adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Janie62
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night break at Jays to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary and booked this hotel after reading all the excellent reviews it had received on Tripadvisor as we wanted somewhere very special to celebrate this occasion. We were not dissappointed, the hotel definately lived up to its no. 1 spot on tripadvisor and we would definately recommend Jays to anyone wanting an extra special hotel for a break in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and deserving of high ranking”
Reviews.Author: maxp69
Reviews.Content: Jays is a fantastic place to stay in Paris. The people that work there are passionate and really make your visit special - use them. The location is great and the hotel and surrounds have everything you need to make a stay in Paris memorable. You will not be disappointed! Thanks for making our honeymoon special, Maxime and Charmaine

Reviews.Title: “Paris bliss!”
Reviews.Author: StyleSeekers
Reviews.Content: We were so spoilt staying at Jays. What a find. The chocolates! The luxury brand toiletries in the bathroom! The daily delivery of fresh fruit! And the staff couldn't do enough to help. They were so welcoming, courteous and helpful. Their recommendations and assistance made our 10 day stay in Paris very special. The hotel itself was quiet and beautiful, a sanctuary of calm with large rooms and high ceilings - we didn't want to leave.
