We would highly recommend Jays to anyone going to Paris and hope one day to be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience all around.”
Reviews.Author: Maddie05
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel with wonderful people working there ready to help out with anything you need. Beds were very comfortable and rooms huge with all the special touches that make your stay that much better. Definately a hotel you could stay in for a long time due to the location, amenities in the room (microwave,refrig) and facilities free of charge at the hotel like internet access as well as a computer. The staff were always friendly and happy to help by making a phone call for reservations or offering advice and suggestions for where to eat or visit to make the most of your stay. We would love to stay at Jays again.

Reviews.Title: “10 stars!!”
Reviews.Author: bijlee
Reviews.Content: If we could give Judy, Stefan and Jays Paris 10 stars, we would! What a fabulous stay my husband and I had here with our children!! Every moment at this hotel was so enjoyable that frankly, we didn't feel like leaving its sanctuary even to venture out into spectacular Paris. I'm not sure what the previous reviewer was referring to when he called this building "nondescript"...it is stunningly beautiful and full of character. From the red carpet that welcomes you in, the skylights that softly illuminate the lobby, the marble staircase that elegantly winds its way up, the intricate wrought iron gates, the lounge filled with roses and orchids, to the understated, tasteful and sophisticated decor- the attention to painstaking detail is abundantly visible at every turn. The welcome we received after a long and tiring train journey is worthy of mention. Instead of walking up to a check in counter, we were seated comfortably in the plush lounge area and Stefan offered us a variety of hot and cold drinks along with cookies while our children squealed with delight at the laughing Elmo in the entryway. The formalities were completed within seconds and we were led up to our room. A lovely little fruit tray and a box of chocolates awaited us in the serenity and beauty of our Fantasie suite which has been superbly decorated with a rare and difficult to achieve aesthetic balance of antique as well as modern furniture and fittings and the softest carpet I have ever stepped on (I want it in my home!!) An array of plush toys had been set up to the sheer joy of our children and my little one had been provided with a lovely set of towels, blankets and a pillow embroidered with teddy bears. The amenities were luxurious with Clarins products in the bathroom, and to our surprise there was even a full kitchen hidden away discreetly within the bar area with a microwave, stove, refrigerator, pots, pans and washing supplies. During our entire stay, Stefan was absolutely phenomenal. He was always ready with a smile and completely pampered us, tending to our every need personally and even running out into the street to ensure our children were safe and walking my son to the corner to point out the Eiffel tower to him. Judy was incredibly warm and kind, reading books to them and even pulled out train sets and toys to happily engage them while we got detailed maps and instructions for our sojourn into Paris from Stefan. I was completely bowled over by them both- we felt like we were staying with unbelievably kind family rather than at a hotel. Even Anthony (from the night staff) took great care of us, quickly and efficiently helping us with all our requests. The morning of our departure, Judy and Stefan took photos of our family with their own camera and saw us out to our taxi smiling and waving goodbye as we drove away. We were literally shaking our heads in disbelief at the overwhelming warmth on their part and were actually sad to leave! Thank you so much tripadvisor for alerting us to this absolute gem. We have stayed at the best hotels in the world including many Leading hotels and Four Seasons and Ritz Carltons and have never experienced anything like this before. We will never stay anywhere else when in Paris and are already awaiting our next trip there. And thank you so much Judy and Stefan- we miss you!!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: PeetsGirl
Reviews.Content: Jays Paris is a very special place. From the moment you are greeted upon check in to the second you depart, you feel pampered by a friendly and professional staff. Every need is anticipated. The rooms are spacious and immaculate. It is truly an oasis in the middle of the hectic city. We cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “I now understand the #1”
Reviews.Author: saxkw
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights at Jays. We've usually stay at larger hotels when we travel so this was a change. When we arrived, the cab pulled up to a nondescript building on a side street of Paris. There was a very small sign next to a blue door and steps leading to an inner door that was locked. As the cab pulled away I thought, "Well, this isn't good". However, once we were seen, all changed. This hotel has all of 5 tidy, comfortable rooms with a staff of 3-4 people. There's no grand lobby, but you feel a sense of calm in a very busy and crowded city. Thus, the main reason for the #1 rating is the absolute 1 on 1 service. The staff is attentive, warm, friendly, and down to earth. We were in town for Bastille Day, and thanks to the staff, we avoided the throngs and instead had a front row seat to the fireworks from our dinner cruise boat. The location is perfect, within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower and the Arc de Triomphe/Champs Elysee. The neighborhood has many cafes, and small shops, and is right next to a large street for easy acces to transportation. Definitely worth the #1.

Reviews.Title: “Fairy Tale, an oasis of dreams, which still exists”
Reviews.Author: AlPol
Reviews.Content: There are so many amazing things said about Jays on the site already that i just dont know where to begin! Let me start by saying i had a wonderful experience at Jays even though there was no elevator, (which I did not know about), but as soon as you walk into Jays, you enter a fairy tale world where all your hospitality needs are met and even excelled! The lobby is filled with sensational aromas of fresh bouquets of flowers everywhere, the little hike up the stairs to your room isn’t even all that bad when you become encapsulated by the amazing décor and service. The feeling I got at Jays is nothing like I’ve ever felt before. I felt like I belonged there, and that I was a special guest at their small hotel that consisted of 5 rooms. I’ll be honest with you, I am a travel agent and I have stayed at some reputable hotels and none of them can even compare to the exclusive category of excellence that Jays had to offer. The Ritz is still a high end hotel in Paris, and I am not going to say anything about their hotel, however unless you’re a celebrity with a big body guard, than don’t expect the celebrity treatment. All the staff at Jays were wonderful, from Edmond to Judy to Phillip, Stephen , Ivan and the rest of the gang! Don’t worry about languages at all! Everyone that works there spoke English (to some extent) and French. A few of staff members also spoke German and Russian, but the point is, there is no language barrier, so don’t worry! They were all unbelievably helpful and tended to any which whim we might have had. As simple as asking where the nearest flower store was, they gave us directions verbally and then printed out directions for us, that came with a map, estimated time of arrival by walking or by taxi, and always made sure to check in with us afterwards that the directions were good. We had an interesting incident happen one day. We came back to the hotel with our friend and went up to the room to freshen up before heading out for dinner. Our friend was very impressed with our room and she pointed out how we had a great selection of fruits already arranged on the table in our room. Within five minutes, one of the kind gentlemen from downstairs walked in with a complimentary tray of chilled Champagne and Foie Gras to welcome our guest... We were astonished! It will stay in our memories for years... What a great experience! For the people who are reading this, PLEASE read the other reviews, they are all very honest and great. They helped me discover Jays Paris, and I am ever so grateful for their amazing words.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, we had trepidations...you should not. Jays is the real deal.”
Reviews.Author: gtenser
Reviews.Content: After 4 nights at the Four Seasons in Provence, we headed up to Paris with our nearly 6 year old and 3.5 year old. We had selected Jays purely on these reviews, and we were admittedly quite nervous. Jays' driver, who had picked us up at the train station (the kids love trains) pulled up to the simple blue doors in the highly trendy 16th arrondissement, and all early trepidations were immediately dispelled. The beautiful marble staircase, the welcoming arms of the eager staff, the professional calm and ease of owner Judy, the Four Seasons style check in (sit on the couch, have a drink, relax and de-stress while the luggage is brought to your room, etc...) after 5 nights my family and I can, without qualification, highly recommend this unique boutique hotel. Rooms: We were given the connecting Provence and Le Duo suites for ourselves and our kids. The only other room on our floor was Le Salon, a bonus room which was essentially our kitchen, sitting room, chess/computer/game room. The kids loved Le Duo – teddy bears and stuffed tigers on the shelves, a beautifully appointed room and bathroom, soft carpeting, low-to-the-ground bed for ease of entry and exit and no nighttime safety concerns. Our Provence suite was extremely spacious, lovely, highly functional and comfortable. The fruit presentation in both rooms that awaited us each day upon our return from sightseeing, as well as the Fauchon chocolates that adorned our pillows as we returned from dinner each night provided delicious accents to the evening. These rooms are quite large, carpeted, comfortable, functional, and tastefully appointed, with immaculate bathrooms attached, top of the line Moen faucets, handheld shower heads in addition to fixed making bathing the kids a breeze. It felt immediately like home. Staff: The staff is terrific, and as you can count the number of total guests on two hands, they essentially work for you and you alone. Philippe, the day manager, offered us his card, so we were able to call him directly with any daytime issues. The entire team was quite helpful, warm and kind, and someone is always on duty – anytime you return, there’s a friendly face welcoming you back, ready to handle any request you might have. Location for Food: The 16th arrondissement is commonly thought to be one of the wealthiest parts of Paris, and it appears that the restaurant industry has caught up with this fact. A handful of Michelin-starred restaurants are literally just a few blocks away. Jays has a large book in the Reception Lounge with menus and representative bills from numerous local eateries, which is a nice touch. Recommendations and write ups of local restaurants are also in your room, and the staff is quick to offer their suggestions. Our first night we took a suggestion and walked two blocks to ETC (Epicurean Traditional Cuisine), run by a former 3-michelin star rated chef (from Ledoyen) and had a terrific tasting menu meal (while ETC gladly outfitted our kids with a fabulous steak and potatoes). There is a fruit and sundries bodega one block away, and a full supermarket around the corner, so we kept our fridge (and the fridge in the salon) filled with beverages and snacks. Two terrific boulangeries (bakery shops for breads and sandwiches-our go-to take out breakfast spots) are well within walking distance. We had some dinner reservations at a few top restaurants in place prior to arrival, but otherwise we felt no need to leave the 16th for dinner, getting our Bistro fix as well as a sushi fix all in easy walking distance. Location for Touring: The Arc de Triomphe de l’Etoile is a few blocks away. The Eiffel Tower is also reached relatively easily by foot, even with the young kids. There are three metro stations serving two different lines no more than a couple of blocks from the hotel. We found Jays to provide a rather easy launching point for our day tours. Bottom line, we will most assuredly return to Jays when we return to Paris. It was truly a home away from home. We were relatively low-touch patrons, not requiring a great deal of aide, and Jays shined. I can easily see how they would also shine for higher-need patrons. We were quite concerned that we booked a hotel solely on the reviews on this site, but take it from us – the place will not disappoint you. Jays is the real deal.

Reviews.Title: “If only we could have stayed longer......”
Reviews.Author: LadyNorwood
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a wonderful three nights in the sublime Jays - from the moment we booked, to the moment their driver took us back to the Gare du Nord, everything was handled with consummate professionalism, nothing was too much trouble. The staff (really don't like to call them that as they were more like hosts) were absolutely faultless, so charming and helpful - it was like staying with friends in a private home. Our room, Le Provence, was light and airy which was very welcome, given that it was 36 degrees on Friday - so hot we could barely move! Fresh fruit and champagne in the room, tins of Fauchon chocolates every evening (not the usual square of indifferent choc left on the pillow), lovely Clarins products in the bathroom, beautiful flowers everywhere, fantastic modern artwork combined with antique furniture, oh and proper coffee - it was blissfully refreshing after staying in some big name hotels around the globe... The stairs can be a bit daunting (there's no lift) but it's only two flights and it's good for the thighs!! Can't wait to go back to Jays, it really is a special place...

Reviews.Title: “Just like home”
Reviews.Author: VKwok
Reviews.Content: Great location - walking distance to shops, friendly restaurants plus grocery and laundry, easy to travel by bus, subway to major tourist attractions. Great room (we had Le Decor I think) - good size plus amenities (we always like to have an electric kettle to get our own hot water and wifii), and a resting section (that has a kitchen & even a mac) on 2/F (and lobby of course) that becomes almost like your living room. Great job by Edwin on housekeeping. Good service - nice touch - fruits were delivered every evening. Great help from Judy and her team (Philippe, Ivan, DJ, Stefan (apologies if I got the names wrong) including choice of restaurants, address of specific shops and even booking of plane and train tickets. Overall, we have yet to find anything close to Jays balancing top service, cleanliness, location with warmth (my wife is full of praise of Jays' touch of red in its decor as red is easily too intrusive when overused). One can easily find hotels with fabulous decor & top service but at the end of the day, you know that is still a hotel, but at Jays you feel at home. And Paris, glad to say we like to be back, and just like a few other great cities, we now have a few restaurants we like to revisit whenever we are back. Victor & Woody, Hong Kong June 2010

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - Go!”
Reviews.Author: JWilks
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Jays. It is beautifully decorated, clean and fresh. Located close to L'arc de Triomphe and also walking distance to the Eiffel Tower it is a central base. Our room was lovely; The bed so comfortable and the nightly delivery of chocolates and fruit platter was bliss! Service at the hotel was quietly efficient, friendly and helpful. It is a special place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel staffed by very special people”
Reviews.Author: 50sbirthday
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit to Paris and my first visit to Jays. The first thing we noted on our arrival was there was no rush just a real sense of calm welcome, a nice drink and a sit down whilst booking in. We had been collected from the airport so all in all by the time we entered our suite we were nicely chilled and ready for a great holiday. We were in the Asie Suite, a beautiful light and spacious room over looking a small roof top garden. A welcome plate of fruit (a fresh one every afternoon) awaited us. We had previously booked our restaurants through Jays after having been sent a list. All of these turned out to be very good. We had intended to go by train to Giverny the next day but unfortunately the trains were on strike so Jays managed to arrange at very short notice a car and driver (William from Calista Privilege) to take us instead. This turned out to be the best part of our trip. He was wonderful even taking us to a store to purchase a charger for my husbands phone which he had forgotten to take. As Versailles which we should have visited in the afternoon was also closed due to the strike, (we have been before so it didn't matter), after lunch at a beautiful riverside restaurant he chose for us, he then took us to some small museums containing impressionist paintings in Paris as he had listened to the kind of places we had wanted to visit. Nothing was too much trouble and this proved to be the point all through our holiday. Over the following days that we spent with Jays they continued to provide us with many suggestions of places to visit some quite different to what we had originally chosen but all proved to be the best choice and their knowledge was greatly appreciated. All in all a wonderful place to stay. Just a couple of points, I did miss contact with other guests as with the hotel only being small we rarely saw anyone else, and the other was that although there was a fridge with wine champagne soft drinks and water that you could help yourself too along with tea and coffee in the lounge, I would have liked to be provided with a complimentary bottle of water in our room but this was charged at 2 euros, which seemed a little odd considering you could take one for nothing from the lounge. Would defiantly stay again if I visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Quite unlike anywhere we have ever stayed before and quite delightful”
Reviews.Author: falcons48
Reviews.Content: This is such a very hospitable environment for a few days in Paris. The hotel is quite unlike anywhere we have ever stayed before and quite delightful. The attention to detail in every respect from surroundings to service is exemplary. The warmth of welcome and the courtesy of all the staff are a testament to a management structure designed entirely to make a stay at Jays a pleasurable experience and I am certain that Judy is the one driving that ethos forward. Our stay in Paris was very greatly enhanced by being based at Jays Hotel. I am sure we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Jays Paris met all our expectations”
Reviews.Author: sierrakos
Reviews.Content: We discovered Jays Paris when we discovered it had the #1 rating for leisure travel in the trip advisor. The ranking is well deserved. Great location, great facility and great service. Judy and her concierge staff were superb. Thank you Judy, Olivie, Stephen, Phillip, Ivan and Eric for taking care of us everyday. Housekeeping was outstanding throughout our stay. All the extras spacious suite, big bathroom with tub and shower, heated towel racks, chocolates and fruit plates every evening. The orchids and peony's throughout the facility and in our room were awesome. What a great way to see Paris and celebrate our 35th anniversary. 5plus on everything from us. Kevin and Becky

Reviews.Title: “exceptional Parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: Voyageur01742
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at this hotel. It has a friendly, personal feel and is in a great location. Everyone was very helpful. The size and location are great advantages. They arranged excellent transportation to and from the airport and found ballet tickets in advance of our arrival. Jane, the guide offered by the hotel, did an excellent job of providing just the kinds of touring that we wanted and was an excellent companion for our touring.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: ralu_gaman
Reviews.Content: Me and my little 7 years old boy, spent 3 nights of Jays. Charming deco, nice and friendly staff, attention for the child, good location, focus for detalis... If you want a special place in Paris: that's it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service”
Reviews.Author: dagGothenburg_Sweden
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at Jays, in one of their suites. I travelled with my wife and 10 year old daugther. The staff is very attentive and every evening they surprised us with a collection of fresh fruit and also champagne. The hotel is perfectly located. Rooms are large, comfortable and quiet. The only downside was one restaurant which they recommended, Le Stresa, which was one of the worst restaurants I have been to in my entire life. Other than that it is truly a great small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: webadair
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. Friendly, helpful staff, nothing too much trouble. Suggested local restaurants for meals and snacks, all of these good. Easy walking distance to the Metro, Arc de Triomphe and the Trocadero Room excellent, sophisticated flowers everywhere in the hotel. We had the hotel taxi from and too the railway station, very good very reasonable. We will defiantly go again soon to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Class”
Reviews.Author: FlyingKiwis314
Reviews.Content: Wow, what an amazing place in an amazing city. Jays is without a doubt the best Hotel that we have ever stayed at and the level of service that we experienced was exceptional. The check in was easy and the bottle of champagne was a nice touch. The rooms are really light and airy with plenty of room. We had a conecting room for our kids and appreciated the fact that they decorated the room full of teddy bears etc. The afternoon snacks of fruit went down a treat. The location was perfect and recommendations for dinner were really well thought out. We would certainly fly half way around the world again to experience Jays again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay, a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nightingale010410
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Jays for 2 nights of our honeymoon. It was fantastic. When they learned it was our honeymoon, they upgraded us which was so generous - and even treated us to a celebratory bottle champagne - ah, the romance! The room was absolutely lovely (and large) with gorgeous 'Coco Chanel' art deco style. They helped us (in advance of our trip) with ideas of things to do in Paris. So when we arrived, they had secured excellent seats at the opera and also made reservations for us at a wonderful fish restaurant. The service was impeccable, friendly and welcoming. We will definitely stay at Jays the next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Loveslogos
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 9 days at Jays in Paris and it was wonderful! The entire staff was so helpful and attentive! Their attention to detail in both service and decor was a delight! They arranged all of our dinner reservations prior to our arrival. Nothing we asked was too difficult for them. The room was very large and comfortable and spotless! JAYS is the perfect place to stay for a romantic get-a-way or even for business. Just a note, there are three floors with no elevator. This could be a problem for some... We stayed on the third floor and actually enjoyed the walk to our room on the very elegant curved staircase. The FREE WIFI was a real bonus!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: marieh1
Reviews.Content: The best hotel in Paris!the staff could not be more helpful!!the room was really comfortable and clean!!!The buffet had a really good variety!I COULD PAY MUCH MORE FOR THIS HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Could not be faulted in every respect. If you want perfection, stay here.”
Reviews.Author: LondonRossie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversay, and we could not have picked a better place to stay. The owner of the hotel clearly sets very high standards of service, which her staff succeeded in deliverying. The whole experience was one we sincerely recommend. If you want affordable luxury, stylishness, cleaniness and attention to detail, Jays is for you. Nothing was too much trouble - a strong service culture throughout. Our only regret was not staying longer.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: BroncoNorthants_UK
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at Jays and will certainly be staying with them on our next visit to Paris. We found everyone extremely helpful to us and loved everything about Jays Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic & original, luxury hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: Dono81
Reviews.Content: The first thing we noticed was how intimate the reception area felt. Nothing like a "normal" hotel reception - we felt as if we were staying in a private house. The building itself is very modern but built in traditional French style. It was spotless, with winding staircases and lots of natural light. When we were shown to our suites we were delighted to discover big, light, airy rooms with high ceilings. The bathrooms were stunning with full sets of Clarins cosmetics for us to use. The double beds were lovely and soft with very clean linen. The hotel is located virtually in the centre of Paris - it was very easy to walk to most places from the hotel. Breakfast was basic continental - croissants & coffee and though there are no other options available at the hotel, the staff did offer to go and get other breakfast food for us and recommended places to eat close by. The staff were all helpful and friendly and we had a fantastic time - THANK YOU.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to relax after a tough business day.....”
Reviews.Author: jand87
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Jays Paris just last week and was treated royally. I arrived very late following a delayed flight and was served a lovely glass of wine while dealing with check in....and although it was late I had the pleasure of enjoying a delicious selection of fresh fruits -- most welcome because I had not eaten dinner at all.....the room was calm and very comfortable. I'll return in the future....it is a lovely place to stay and relax after a day of work or travel.

Reviews.Title: “The ambiance and service second to none”
Reviews.Author: sorboman
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Jays was memorable because of the warmth of the welcome and the attention to detail in the presentation of the suites and the very personable service of the staff. The suites were beautifully furnished and also extremely comfortable . Every need of the guest has been catered for and we were supprised and delighted by all the little extras that came so unexpectedly. Thank you Jays for a memorable Parisian interlude and Jays will be the place we lay our heads whenever we visit Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “A Ravishing Respite!”
Reviews.Author: Food-and-Wine-Critic
Reviews.Content: Jays is not a hotel, but a home away from home. It only offers five unique suites in a beaux arts townhouse in the 16th a stone’s throw from the Arc de Triumph—but they are each gems. On a return visit, we found the amenities and elegance even more alluring. Judy and the rest of the attentive staff are there to help make your visit to Paris seamless and enjoyable—they print weather reports in the morning to help you start your day, and maps after they have made your requested dinner reservations, to aid direction. They serve coffee and tea in the intimate lobby decorated in red, and every afternoon a lovely fruit plate is waiting in the room. Fauchon and Hediard delicacies are offered. And rooms have little kitchens! You can get all of the facts – location, pictures of rooms, amenities – from a hotel brochure; but what you can get only from travelers’ reviews is how special it is to stay at Jays. We would not even think about staying any place else!

Reviews.Title: “A true Gold Standard in it's class”
Reviews.Author: Smikehunt
Reviews.Content: We are frequent Paris travellers and wanted to write to say we felt Jay's is really quite something. The owner and staff have created quite simply a new Gold standard for Hotels on the Continent.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonBridges77
Reviews.Content: We had a great weekend break in Paris helped in large part to Jays's recomendations and helpful staff. From arranging restaurant bookings to in room massages and a fabulous tour of the Lourve, couple that with the small but perfectly formed hotel and extremely helpful and enthusiastic staff. it was a stay we will always remember. Oh and we got engaged while we were there....! Highly recomend.

Reviews.Title: “excellent and exotic”
Reviews.Author: Shyams
Reviews.Content: This was my first ever business trip to paris and I happend to stay at this exotic hotel. Its a very lovely place. the staff did everything to make our experience a decent and nice one. I can't say about tis hotel in comparison to other hotels as this is the only hotel where I have stayed in Paris, but beleive me this is the best in all.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Toman123
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time at Jays. The service is impeccable. The best we have ever experienced, and we travel a lot.

Reviews.Title: “True Reflection of Parisian Elegance”
Reviews.Author: SMGRNYC
Reviews.Content: Having spent two nights at Jays Paris in the heart of Paris only a few blocks from the spectacular Arc de Triumphe I feel as if I have become wary of a secretly grandiose elegance that only the well cultured can fully appreciate (however this hasn't stopped me from trying). It is one thing to observe the city as a tourist from just any hotel but another experience completely to glance down across the Parisian cityscape from the intimate splendor of a room at Jays Paris. The regal furnishings and the fine detail of service exceed even a romanticized city of the imagination. After a stay at Jays every memory of Paris will bring to mind a distinctly personal image of the city gilded with style and grace.

Reviews.Title: “Unmissable, so refreshing to stay somewhere where service is everything”
Reviews.Author: Lambethtraveller
Reviews.Content: We’ve just returned from a great stay at Jays. It’s so refreshing to stay somewhere where service is everything, and all the staff are passionate about making sure you feel welcome. The rooms are gorgeous, loved the fresh fruit, chocolates and Clarins products. We stayed in the Art Deco suite, it was perfect. We got two great restaurant reservations from Julie and Olivier and all the staff sat down with us and offered helpful suggestions as to what to do in Paris during our stay, offering us foie gras and champagne before we headed out for our Valentines meal. Really couldn’t recommend the hotel more for the fantastic level of commitment from the staff to ensuring you thoroughly enjoy your stay, very very unusual in my experience! Well done

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jeffsutherland
Reviews.Content: I'm in Paris regularly on business and always stay at Jays. From pickup at the airport to return everything is done to perfection. Rooms are elegant and some have a nice desk to work in which is important on business. They know I like a Nespresso machine in my room so it is always there. It is a small hotel so you get extra attention from their incredible staff. Definitely deserves to be #1 in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: MMC67
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Jays last month was wonderful. The 2 rooms we stayed in, the lobby / lounge area and above all the service from the staff was great. In addition we liked the fact that we were located close to Champs Elysee but were away from the hustle - bustle. My wife and I had a wonderful time at Jays. We enjoyed our short break. If in Paris, we would choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home, but with all the extras!”
Reviews.Author: Sharinds
Reviews.Content: Our experience with this hotel started before we even got on a flight, Judy was excellent at communicating via email allowing us the ability to tailor our time in Paris perfectly. Everything from the welcome to the friendly hellos by all the members of staff. Our holiday in Paris was made more memorable by the great restaurants that were picked by Judy and her team and the proximity to all the shops and metro station. specific highlights were the fruit platters each day, the beautiful furniture in the room (Louis XVI), selection of reading material and the cosiness of the whole place. you are greeted everytime you walk in and nothing is too hard for the hotel staff to do. Excellent place, great location, great value.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, classy, comfy, a chocoholics delight”
Reviews.Author: Acurob
Reviews.Content: My wife and went to Paris for 7 days in January, a combination vacation and business trip. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was huge, for Paris, and quiet. The bed was comfortable and large. Fauchon's chocolates every night on the pillow. The bathroom was large and the towels kept warm. The robes were actually large enough to use. The temperature control was easy to operate. Very helpful for my work was the free high speed wifi internet connection. They had umbrellas in the lobby available.The location couldn't have been better, and we had many a nice evening walk to restaurants and the metro. Not a bad stroll to either Trocadero or the Arc de Triomphe. Fresh fruit each night in the room after our evening out. The staff was a great help in recommending restaurants, stores, museums, often offering a glass of wine while we planned out the evening. We have been to Paris at least 20 times and this was the best hotel experience we have ever had. This was also the most expensive Paris hotel we have ever stayed in, and it was worth it. If you are ready to pamper yourself, this is the place to do it.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel, awesome staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: GeraldGUsa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four nights at Jays-Paris in late November 2009, and it was an exceptional stay. I benchmarked our time at Jays-Paris to other recent stays in Paris "luxury" hotels (e.g., Hotel Intercontinental Paris, Hotel Raphael), and I found that Jays-Paris roundly exceeded those established hotels in every facet of value, design, and service. Jays-Paris boasts large, modern, and well-appointed suites (see photo of our suite - the Aise suite) set amidst a quiet and perfectly located address. Some of the best city views, walks, cafes, restaurants, and sights are within a very short walk of this great hotel, which further adds to the value of a stay at Jays-Paris. Additionally, the owner and staff of Jays-Paris warrant a special note of appreciation. Their attention to detail, respect of privacy, city knowledge, and dedication to customer service is the new gold standard for Paris hotels in my opinion. My wife and I lived in Paris for a couple of years, followed by several return visits to the city, and we simply cannot recall ever experiencing a hotel with such a genuine commitment to service as we experienced at Jays-Paris. Thanks again to Jays-Paris, we will certainly see you again!

Reviews.Title: “Is it really this good?”
Reviews.Author: Cuilfail
Reviews.Content: I asked myself, could Jays really be as good as the ratings on Tripadvisor, or will this be a triumph of expectation and hype over reality? I hope I'm a well seasoned traveller and certainly know what to expect in luxury hotels. Jays did not disappoint, suffice to say all you read is correct, Judy and the team are exceptional – I have never stayed anywhere else where the cleaner stopped what he was doing to help me with my bags – this is just one of dozens of cases of our needs being both anticipated and meet almost without asking. The upshot? On checking out from our two night stay I booked a four night one later this year and will probably go back again even before that. I can offer no higher praise.

Reviews.Title: “Bullseye Trip Advisor”
Reviews.Author: birchgrovesydney
Reviews.Content: I must admit i have had mixed success with Trip Advisor reviews,indeed at times i felt i have been staying at a different hotel then the one reviewed which prompted my stay.But i concur with all the reviews i have read of Jays. We stayed in room 203 and arguably it was the biggest room i have encountered in over 30 years of travel to Europe. Extremely comfortable ,quiet ( I am not the worlds best sleeper) and with a staff that were very pleasant and eager to please..This was the first time we have stayed in that part of Paris between Champs and the Eifel Tower. I found the area stylish and felt safe in my wanderings at night around the various local restaurants. Yes, i enjoyed my stay there and would certainly return.It is small( 5 rooms )but gives one the feeling of an exclusive apartment block.

Reviews.Title: “6 stars for the price of 4”
Reviews.Author: NPA
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed one night at Jays and the hotel is great and highly recommendable. The best is the staff. The are 6 stars out of a five star system. The location is 5 stars and the rooms are also 5 stars. There is no pool or gym, but who needs that when you go to the town of love. Love in wine, love in food and love in your spouse. In Paris you usually have to pay for 5 stars and you have to pay a lot. Sometimes you also pay for a reputation that was valid maybe during de Gaulle or Pompidou, but not anymore. At Jays, you do not need to pay for the 5 stars. You pay for 3 to 4 stars depending on the current offers. The hotel is small, only five suites, so its very peaceful. We will be back! Many thanks Judy, the New Zealand expat who runs the hotel and provides excellent incoming service and also many thanks to the rest of the team! Great job!

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: nardyaw
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Jays for a long weekend recenty for his birthday. Neither of us had been to Paris for many years so when looking for inspiration for places to stay I read the reviews on Tripadvisor and Jays came out tops. I was lucky enough to get a good deal for the time we went, and from the moment I booked I received a great welcome email from Judy with an explanation of Jays and a great list of reccomended restaurants. Judy then helped me to book a couple of special places to eat ,my favorite being Le Hide. We arrived in Paris by Eurostar; wow how great is that to be in Paris from London in just over 2 hours, superb! I arranged the chauffeur pick up from Jays, charged at 50 Euros which is pretty much what a cab would cost and was very convenient. We stayed in the Empire suite which is their smallest suite but very spacious I think for Paris standards. The room was lovely, high ceilings and nice furnishings, the bathroom was well stocked with fabulous Clarins products, bathrobes and slippers. Jays is the creation of Judy, a Parisian Residence converted into a very stylish, tranquil boutique hotel. All the staff are very charming, professional and very well conversed, they all took time to chat and gave us great advice of where to visit and eat. Jays is very well positioned for walking to the Arc De Triomphe, Champs Elysee and the Eiffel Tower, it is also easy to get on a metro from nearby. I have only one small suggestion for Judy and that would be to add a little background music to the lounge area, we actually liked sitting there when we came in from walking all day to have a refreshment but felt it was a little too quiet. It has been a long time since we both visited Paris but this time we will definately be back sooner and will definately stay at Jays again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: AHK22
Reviews.Content: We decided to choose Jay’s over the more established big name hotels (Le Meurice, Lancaster etc) and the boutique ones (L’Abbaye St Germain, Montalembert etc) after much research and because of the excellent TA reviews, and we are glad we did. We were given a healthy discount because of the length of our stay, which sealed the deal. Bigger hotels are not as flexible. Our room (Suite Asie) was on the first floor at the back of the hotel, so no traffic noise but still plenty of light streaming in through three enormous French windows overlooking a terrace. We had a quick peek at 2 other rooms and much preferred ours. It was the largest room we have ever had in any hotel in Paris. Clarins toileteries, Fauchon chocolates and fresh fruit every day as well as an Ipod dock, flat screen TV, DVD player, discreet cupboards with kettle, coffee etc (and microwave!) were great touches. Service was outstanding. The team makes you feel very much at home (but gave you some space as well!) and bent over backwards to help. Between booking the room and arriving for our stay, they sent us a list of their recommended restaurants and offered to reserve tables for us. Good advice given that the best are booked months in advance! At one point, the air conditioning packed up in our room but they had someone fix it within an hour despite the fact it was 8pm on a Friday! Jay’s is located in the 16th,, an area which is very upmarket and residential and therefore not very “happening”. It is however 5 mins walk to the Champs Elysees, 7 mins walk to the Trocadero for an excellent view of the Eiffel Tower and 20mins by Metro to the Marais or St Germain.

Reviews.Title: “Believe Everything You Read”
Reviews.Author: Jmbisset
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Paris for our wedding anniversary and wanted somewhere special to stay. Having read all the great reviews on Tripadvisor Jays seem to fit the bill. The fantastic service you receive from Judy and her staff begins the moment you make contact with Jays. Email enquiries are dealt with promptly and contain all the information you could require. Having booked the only disappointment is that your visit cannot begin immediately. We decided to avail of Jay's chauffer service from CDG-a very elegant way to leave the airport and arrive in style. It also takes the hassle out of getting transport to the heart of Paris. On arrival into Jays our breath was taken away-Judy has managed to create an oasis of charm, character and calm just minutes from the centre of Paris-you immediately feel relaxed and know that here is something very special. After a refreshing drink, Judy showed us to our room. We stayed in a Deluxe Suite and it is luxury. Clarins products in the bathroom, a wonderfully comfortable bed and personal touches like chocolates and fresh fruit every night. Breakfast is simple but wonderful and was more than enough to start our day. The staff at Jay's are wonderful-Ivan and Stephan who we had most contact with, made us feel like nothing was too much bother and all queries were dealt with efficiently and promptly. Jays biggest bonus is its location. A 5 minute walk in one direction and you are at the Arc De Triomphe-10 minutes the other way and you at the Eiffel Tower. You may think this would put Jays in the middle of a noisy chaos but it is peaceful and quiet and perfect. We had a wonderful 3 nights at Jays and will certainly return here when we are next in Paris. If you are looking for somewhere special to stay, where the staff treat you like friends first and then guests, Jays can be your only destination.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Hotel and a Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: will39
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 19-year old daughter and I stayed here for 4 nights and loved every moment. The hotel is immaculate and beautifully appointed. Our room was lovely and comfortable and the staff treated us so warmly. We had planned to stay at a larger chain hotel until I discovered Jays on Tripadvisor and I am so happy that we changed our plans. As others have stated, there were chocolates and fresh fruit in our room each night when we returned from our adventures which was such a treat. More than anything, the staff was extremely helpful and made us feel at home. They provided us with wonderful restaurant recommendations and printed directions when we needed them. I can't say enough good things about our experience at Jays!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks TripAdvisor, A Cracking Recommendation”
Reviews.Author: Attila-le-Hun
Reviews.Content: Having been unimpressed by Parisian hotels in the past (small rooms, noisy neighbourhoods, surly/arrogant staff etc), we decided to pay a little bit extra and try out Jays based on the numerous glowing reviews on TripAdvisor. We were not disappointed. All the staff without exception were incredibly welcoming (without being obsequious), charming and helpful. The location was ideal, tucked away on a quiet back street, 10 mins walk from the Eiffel Tower and the banks of the Seine to the South, and Arc de Triomphe 7 mins stroll to the North. The hotel, and the rooms in particular, were tastefully decorated to a high standard, and although the hotel is somewhat on the small side (which incidentally we thought added to the charm), the rooms are very spacious, which is unusual for Paris. Ok, so there is no dining room/restaurant or bar, but there are so many excellent restaurants/cafes nearby for it not to be an issue. There is also the flexibility of a kitchenette, so bringing food and drink into your room is not a problem, unlike most other hotels I could mention. We would thoroughly recommend this quaint little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “JAYS Paris in fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: MarieSJC
Reviews.Content: As world travelers, I use TripAdvisor to plan vacation/business trips for my husband and myself. Comments and reviews on TripAdvisor have been very helpful in this world of lavish websites only to arrive at less than attractive surroundings. You cannot rate service on a hotel website. I've had the opportunity to stay at Jays Hotel in Paris on 2 separate occasions during the past 2 years. Both stays were delightful experiences! The hotel is indeed a five-star, with an extremely attentive staff, in a lovely neighborhood. I cannot understand why anyone would give a poor review of this establishment, especially when Jays Hotel has been the #1 hotel in Paris for so long. If you have never been to Paris or if you love going to Paris, I highly recommend staying at Jays.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT-TREATED LIKE ROYALTY-WONDERFUL STAFF”
Reviews.Author: PHARMANewJersey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 8 nights at Jays Paris celebrating our 25th anniversary. Judy and her MARVELOUS staff made our first visit to Paris a truly FANTASTIC experience. Jays is a cozy boutique set in a very nice Parisian neighborhood. Each day Jays' staff made us feel like a part of their family providing all the Amenities (chocolates and fruits each evening in our room) along with the Intimate Charm you would expect from a first class Boutique in Paris. A ROMANTIC HIDEAWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Don't try the rest TRY THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: sharuss
Reviews.Content: When you read reviews you are never sure how correct they are, we always check reviews before booking hotels, sometimes they are spot on and other times they are way off the truth. The reviews for Jays are all true. This is a fantastic small and intimate hotel run by staff who really understand what customer care means. From the moment my husband sent the first e mail to enquire about a booking to when we stepped over the door to leave we were looked after. The hotel is well situated; there is only a small gold plaque on the wall to say it’s a hotel and check in was more like having coffee with friends. With regards to the rooms style and cleanliness other reviewers have said it all, past reviews also talk extensively about the level of service and while it would be easy for me to agree with them I feel very strongly that however wonderful a hotel looks if you are treated well that’s what will make you return time and time again. Jays staff can’t do enough for you, they are never pushy, advise rather than dictate and make you feel totally comfortable We were really looked after and if you visit you can be assured that whatever you require from restaurants bookings to museum and train information Jay’s wonderful staff will assist you. If we return to Paris we will only do so if we can stay at Jays.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: PSConsulting
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights at Jays and have only good things to say about it. Our room was excellent, spacious and comfortable and the staff could not have been more helpful. Our stay was so relaxing, we can't wait to go back - has to be the best hotel in Paris. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, Yes, Yes - it is that good!”
Reviews.Author: RaT3
Reviews.Content: You read the reviews and think ,can this hotel be that good? Well it is! Great location, great staff and really large rooms with very good facilities. we stayed six nights and Judy and the staff are what make the difference, nothing is any trouble and they will get you into the best restaurants in Paris. It is more like a private home rather than a hotel. Cannot wait to return to Jays.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT! OUR EXPERIENCE WAS BEYOND OUR EXPECTATIONS!”
Reviews.Author: thackett
Reviews.Content: Hotel JAYS was FABULOUS! My Husband and I celebrated our 25TH Anniversary in Europe and thru all of our stays in Europe, Hotel JAYS and the staff, JUDY, PHILLIP and STEPHAN were wonderful and made our stay in Paris EXCELLENT! This was a five star hotel with a five star experience! We highly recommend it!!!!! THERESA H. THE WOODLANDS

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: frcarter
Reviews.Content: I have been to Paris many times before but have never stayed any where quite as magnificent as Jays. From the moment you arrive you are greeted with warmth and kindness by the lovely staff who accommodate your every need. The hotel itself is beautiful and lavishly decorated. The bedrooms are spacious - which is quite often hard to find in Paris - and beautifully decorated, each possessing its own unique style and flare. We stayed in the Provincial Suite which had elegant French style furniture. The bed was delicious with pillows your head just sinks into....so relaxing that after a day treading Paris's cobbled stones it is just what your body needs. We spent a lot of time in the art deco inspired sitting room which is a lovely place to have complimentary tea in the morning or a french glass of champagne in the evening. Fresh flowers every day and the latest information about art exhibitions, shows, and restaurant recommendations. Everything in Jays is done to perfection from the clarins beauty products in the bathroom to the fresh chocolates on the pillow. I feel enormous friendship and thanks to the staff who went out of there way to make Jays the best stay in Paris I have ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “The best service you could ask for!”
Reviews.Author: GOMIZZOUTIGERS
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the service at this terrfic boutique hotel. Stephen and Kersey were great and did everything possible to make our 5 night stay a memorable one. My fiancee and I stayed in the Provence suite which is beautiful and huge! While it is not a cheap hotel, it is an excellent value, considering what you get. I would encourage anyone traveling to Paris to choose Jays. All these great reviews are right on point!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME Visit!”
Reviews.Author: Travel188
Reviews.Content: We stayes at Jays for 5 nights. My husband and I traveled with our two small children. The staff were so friendly and accomodating to every need we had. The staff treated our kids like one of the family, our kids were so at home. The hotel is lovely, very clean, and in a great location. We will all be returning to Jays in the near future. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved, loved it here!”
Reviews.Author: L&JinVA
Reviews.Content: What can I say that has not already been said about Jays Paris? We stayed for four night in early July and absolutely enjoyed every minute of our stay. I could write a couple pages gushing over our experience at Jays. All the compliments that have been written in previous postings, we also experienced. This posting will focus on some specific things that stuck out in our minds. Booking: The first-class service begins the moment you contact them. We booked our stay with the hotel directly and received a significantly discounted rate, as well as an upgrade to a suite. Before we arrived, they emailed a pretty comprehensive list of recommended local restaurants and arranged for a driver to pick us up at the airport (a choice we truly appreciated after the long flight). We arrived extremely early for check in, so Philippe made us a couple of cups of coffee and recommended a place to get breakfast near the Eiffel Tower. The room: We stayed in the Louis XIV suite- it looks exactly like the photo on the website. The suite was very spacious and clean. The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable and the drapes blocked out the light. The rooms are quiet- you feel like you are the only patrons in the hotel. There was a small hidden kitchenette in the room. We didn't really use it to make anything, but used the refrigerator for our water. The Clarins products: Ok- this gets its own category. Clarins is a great product, so it is a real treat to get that in a hotel. What has not been said about the Clarins products is that Jays goes beyond the standard shampoo, conditioner, and soap (glycerin, body, and face) for the toiletries. A thoughtful surprise was the inclusion of Clarins body exfoliator, satin oil finish, and aromatherapy oil. In addition, there was a nice had soap and rose lotion that was also in the room. You felt like you were pampering yourself after each shower. The special touches: Each afternoon a plate of fresh fruit was waiting in the room when we came back with a handwritten note. Philipe walking you to the cab or or the corner to ensure that you were walking in the right direction. Stephen helping us buy our train tickets to Bayeux for the middle part of our journey. Gerrit helping us make dinner reservations with one hour's notice. Gerrit taking the time to get to know us and making recommendations for neighborhood that he thought we would appreciate for dinner and drinks (and he was absolutely right!) On our last night, we were treated to a small bottle of champagne to celebrate our last night and Stephen took a couple of pictures. The staff (see also Special Touches): Jays Paris has an amazing staff. At no time did you think that it was a job for them- they are truly excellent hosts. Although there is no restaurant at the hotel, but any time we were in the lobby, they were quick to offer cups of espresso, coffee, sodas, water- anything to make you feel relaxed. Our afternoon and evening coffees led to some truly wonderful conversations with Stephen and Gerrit that were a lot of fun. We always hated for them to end and they were a big part of why our stay in Paris was so enjoyable. Neighborhood: The hotel is in a quiet neighborhood within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower and the Arc de Triomphe. Although, the neighborhood is not strong on nightlife, it is has plenty of bistros that stay open to about midnight or so. There is a small place at the bottom of the hill that we went to a couple of times that was great for a nightcap. The staff there was also very friendly and it was within stumbling distance of Jays. If you are looking for something livelier, cabs are plentiful and the fares are not too expensive. Post-booking. Going back to the airport, Jays arranged for their driver to take us back to the hotel. Making the trip back stress-free. All drivers fees were added to our hotel bill so we did not have to deal with a payment. Once we got home, we received an email thanking us for our stay and the pictures we posed for the day before. Another thoughtful reminder of our stay. From the minute we decided to stay at Jays Paris, it was an experience of thoughtful service. After so many complimentary postings, the expectations for Jays is high. They meet these expectations quite easily. When we go back to Paris (and we will), Jays will be our hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly staff, lovely small hotel”
Reviews.Author: coachapril
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Paris where i had the pleasure of spending two nights at the lovely Jays hotel in Paris. I chose Jays because of all the great reviews. I will return there because of its wonderful staff. Jays gave the most welcoming reception to my 9 year old daughter and me. After a long flight arriving in a foreign city ,they made us feel welcome and at home immediately. Everyone spoke great English, attended to our ever possible need. They helped with directions, internet use, reservations, even walked us to the Post office when we asked where it was. This is not the greatest location for a first visit to Paris unless you are there for haute couture shopping but the service out weights the extra metro stops!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: MikeM67
Reviews.Content: Took my daughter to Paris for a short break, and decided to stay at Jays. Had a wonderful stay. Staff are incredibly kind, and are always willing to help. Such a contrast to the poor service I have received in other hotels in Paris. We had a wonderful stay, and will certainly be back. Rooms are huge, with wonderful decor and great facilities (tv, microwave, hot plate, fridge, etc). Great location, near to the Arc de Triomphe and the Eiffel Tower. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The best accommodation experience we've had”
Reviews.Author: GreenFrogsAreTheBest
Reviews.Content: For our last two days in Paris we decided to spoil ourselves by staying at Jays. We weren't disappointed. The service was phenomenal, and the rooms were beautiful. Everywhere you looked there were really thoughtful little touches. The staff provided us with a fruit platter each day. The beds and linen were very comfortable. The doona in itself was a marvel of comfort. Another pleasantly surprising thing about Jays was the style. Wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Best service in any hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: JamesTFisher
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent part of our honeymoon in Paris, and for a week we stayed at Jays, which is more of a home away from home than a hotel. With only a few rooms, the staff there make you feel very comfortable and give the best possible service. Rooms are large, clean and very quiet. The hotel has a feeling of real tranquility - an absolute gem of a find in Paris. Thanks to the Jays' team for helping make our honeymoon fabulous! James and Molly Fisher.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are deserved”
Reviews.Author: woodsie2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights at Jays and all of the good reviews here are correct. The service was impeccable (down to printed directions for each restaurnat that they had booked for us) and all the special little touches. Location is great out of mainstream but still incredibly close to everything. Rooms are very spacious and nicely decorated all in all you would be mad to stay anywhere else

Reviews.Title: “One night was not enough”
Reviews.Author: MiamiLuv2go
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, I booked this hotel for 2 reasons,; first, the reviews from Trip Advisor and second, when I contacted the hotel to check on the best available rates, I was offered a really fantastic offer that included an upgrade to the Provencal Room. I had no idea what that room was like but the offer was good enough to book the hotel. When we arrived at the hotel, the outside was completely uneventful and discreet. Once inside, it was like arriving at a rich relatives town home. It was relaxed and elegant with a touch of modern with classic. Very different from any other place I have stayed at before. The staff was extremely professional and helpful. They offered suggestions for lunch and dinner and made all our arrangements. Only negative: no elevator. We went up a circular stairway to our room. The room was large and comfortable. The decor was French country. The best part of the experience was the toiletries. Best products from Clarins. We could have stayed here at least 3 or 4 nights. We will come back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the family, wonderful location.”
Reviews.Author: gnvhp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July 2009 with three children aged 9, 7 and 5. We had two beautiful adjoining rooms on the first floor (2nd floor in the US) which were wonderfully decorated. We arrived and they were still exchanging the 'grown up' furnishings for the childrens' furnishings to make them feel at home. Teddybears and all. Amazing. Most importantly, the staff were wonderful - really wonderful. Very personal and incredibly proactive in all their attention - plates of fruit, drinks for the kids at all times of the day of night. No need for a babysitter; they will watch the kids and call you if your kids need you. Perfect. It is like visiting with good friends. Highly recommended indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Viva la Jays”
Reviews.Author: mrcohibaMiami
Reviews.Content: Believe the hype. We webt there for our honeymoon and we are so glad we did. We were lucky enough to get an upgrade during our stay even thou there superior room is just as beautiful as there deluxe rooms. Besides the rooms being spacious and beautiful, it's the service that you get that takes them to the next level. I can give you many examples but I;\'ll leave you with one. My wife and I where traveling to Deauville, france on the spur of the moment and Phillipe and Judy booked our room and our train tickets for us so all we had to do is wake up the next morning and jump on the bus to the train station. Just to be sure we wouldn't miss our train, Phillipe walked us to the bus station about a half block away, in his three piece suit, and made sure we got on the right bus. I could go on with many other stories about Paul, Garrett, Stepan, and Edwin (we stayed for 4 days so we got to know them all) but i hope you get the picture. If they read this.....Thank you all for a great experiance.

Reviews.Title: “We loved staying at Jays”
Reviews.Author: 30may08
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at Jays on our 10th anniversary trip after reading the great reviews in trip advisor , and I can happily say that it was a great choice. Our room was excellent, and the hotel service and compliments superb. The staff is really willing to serve and help, and the hotel location is very good. Jays really helped us enjoy our special weekend in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “One night in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Goose31
Reviews.Content: My wife and i unfortunately only had one night in Paris on route home but were fortunate to stay at Jays. We were taken care of by the staff with 5 star service. Our room was spacious and comfortable. The hotel is a 3 minute walk to a metro station and has a few nice restuarants close by. One in particular that was recomended by the manager on duty was called ETC just a block away. Although expensive the food and service were outstanding. The staff and management bent over backwards to make our stay a memorable one. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place inParis”
Reviews.Author: Toffeecat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights & had a lovely time. We were well looked after by all the staff we met, they were friendly & helpful at all times. We stayed 1 night in the Empire Suite & were 'upgraded' to the Asie for the 2/3rd nights (very nice). To be honest the room was larger & at the back of the hotel, but both were wonderfully comfortable & charming. We enjoyed the freedom of making our own breakfast when we wanted, having a fridge for water & drinks & also having the luxury of such good service & help from the staff when needed. I celebrated my 50th birthday while we were there & I was very kindly, treated to champagne & fois gras with compliments from Jays. We ate out at restaurants recommended by Jays on two nights & we weren't disappointed, the food was excellent & the service charming & unobtrusive. We thought the location was great, near enough to access all the sights, yet out of the bustle to be quiet. All in all first class.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful oasis in Paris”
Reviews.Author: BPG415
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at Jays this past month. The staff are unbelievable--helpful, kind, thoughtful, but discreet. The rooms are lovely (the two that I saw), and the entrance & common areas are really nice as well. I was able to take advantage of a very short lived promotional rate (I guess the economy affected even luxury hotels), so would have found the full rate a little steep, but probably still worth it. My only other (mildly) negative comment would be the location: the 16th is a little out of the way, but there's also something to be said for a slightly quieter neighborhood, that's somewhat residential. Definitely I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Staff and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Smith803
Reviews.Content: Expectations are hard to manage when you're the #1 Trip Advisor rated hotel in Paris! Judy and her staff certainly go out of their way to insure their guests are comfortable and needs are met. Every evening I returned to my room to find a nice fruit plate. My room was a little small, but I was traveling alone and it was fine for me. The room overlooked the street below and there was a small balcony. I pulled out a chair, enjoyed the fruit plate, glass of wine and a good book. At night it was a little noisy but I use ear plugs and eye shades...wasn't a problem. Enjoyed dinner at Victor. Good value and service. Check directly with the hotel for better rate. I called the week before, they had a cancellation and was I given a discount on my room.

Reviews.Title: “Wow...we were disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Chanel16
Reviews.Content: Maybe I was so excited about the unbelievable reviews of this hotel my expectations were warped. We had no nice greeting champagne or anything offered.....not even a welcome gift in the room. There was no afternoon reception parties that I read about etc. Unless you get the Deluxe rooms, the superior one (Empire) room is tiny! Yes the bed was comfortable but for the amount of money we paid I expected a pure suite. This particular room is also facing the street and was pretty noisy with the traffic. We stayed in a 5 star in Nice that was alot less expensive and the room was gorgeous!!!!! The hotel staff is certainly very very sweet but again I expect to be wowed when I am paying over $500.00 a night for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “In the world of 5 star hotels Jays is definitely a 6!”
Reviews.Author: latte_fan
Reviews.Content: The level of personal service, attention to detail, and never ending kindness the staff at Jays shows every guest is top notch. Gerrit is a jem, he was always there to answer questions, offer sightseeing advice, restaurant recommendations, tips on getting around the city when a transit strike hit. The room, specifically the Empire suite, was simply elegant and contained every luxury a traveler could want; Clarins toiletries, Hediard Chocolates, fluffy bathrobes, discreet kitchenette, remote control lighting, flat panel television (including plenty of English speaking channels), wi-fi, cashmere blankets, the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in while away from home. The room and en suite bathroom were both generously sized. Location is outstanding, ten minute walk from the Arc De Triumph and Champs de Elysee. There are plenty of cafes and restaurants in the surrounding area to satisfy all foodie cravings.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Experience”
Reviews.Author: Pyrojilly
Reviews.Content: From the minute you decide to stay here to the moment you check out, no detail is overlooked. The small staff (Phillipe, Stephan, Gerrit, and Paul) are like your personal concierge. They can satisfy your every desire and expectation when it comes to what you want on holiday. The rooms are spacious, clean, and beautiful. The hotel is discreetly luxurious and minutes away from the Arc de Triomphe and Eiffel tower. What is there not to like about Jays? Absolutely wonderful. My husband and I will make it our home away from home when we are in Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: sbags
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had an amazing trip to Paris, and Jays played a big part in our enjoyment. From the time we booked until we checked out, we had top-notch service, excellent advice and comfortable accommodations. Don't miss a chance to stay at this world-class boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Look no more”
Reviews.Author: richardcpa
Reviews.Content: First time in Paris and can't wait to return to this fantastic city and the best hotel I've ever stayed at. If you don't like warm welcomes, informative and courteous staff that literally wait to serve you the second you walk into the lobby, stylish, luxurious suites that you would expect to pay twice the price for and management that takes the time to contact you "prior to your arrival" ensuring that all of your needs, desires and expectations are satisfied before you set foot in their hotel---then choose another place to stay. Oh yes, the location--a ten minute walk to the Eiffel Tower, the Arch of Triumph and the Champ Elysees.

Reviews.Title: “Look no more”
Reviews.Author: DavidofWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: If what you want is a small, well appointed hotel with personalized service and a convenient, quiet location, then Jays is it. Judy and the entire staff aim to make your stay a seamless pleasure. If you must stay connected, Jays provides free wireless and access to a computer and printer should you need one. Excellent tea and coffee is available in the public sitting areas as well as the rooms. Located in the 16th, just a short walk from to the left, the Arch du Triumph, and to the right. Trocadero. The location is close to transportation and has an abundance of excellent dining options.

Reviews.Title: “We've Found Our Home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Swdavis
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. We loved staying at Jay's. Phillipe and Judy are fabulous and helped with all of our Paris exploring and restaurants. It's like staying at someone's beautiful home. We've told all of our friends about Jay's. We've truly found our home in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Flycasterwa
Reviews.Content: Spent four days during the holidays at Jays all due to reviews here at TA. Checked in late after long flight from Seattle. Met with espresso and friendly faces. Luggage (BIG) was taken upstairs and the room prepared. Champagne was delivered at our door shortly thereafter. Room was large compared to other Paris hotel rooms. Comfy bed, nice bathroom. My only observation that may be critical is the bathroom should be updated. Could use some improvements. Large bath but not optimal for 6’4 big guy to try and shower. But really, minor. Great amenities in bath or so says my sig other. Small boutique hotel, like staying at someone’s very nice home. Close to everything, on a very quiet street in a residential neighborhood. AWESOME people working there, like having your own personal concierge. Maps, taxies, and advice on demand and as needed. Or if you want to be left alone and disappear, discretion is there also. Only warning is that if you stay here, be prepared to be disappointed with other hotels, we came back after two weeks traveling through Italy and Jays was not available. We stayed at another hotel, and no comparison. You get what you pay for and we got what we would expect and then some. No big fancy lobby, no restaurant or bar, however there are multiple locations for both within an easy walking distance. If you want to feel less like a tourist and more like a welcome guest this is the place. Thank you Jays staff for a memorable Paris trip.

Reviews.Title: “Staff extraordinaire!! Lucious accommodations! Just AMAZING! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: TexasCoco
Reviews.Content: As a single traveler, I felt so welcomed and personally cared for by each and every member of the staff at JAYS. From being driven to and from the airport by a private driver, to flowers, fresh fruit, and a wonderful little gift for my birthday. Coming home to a friendly face and wonderful conversation over a glass of champagne, fresh fruit, and luscious chocolates after a day of walking the Paris streets was a wonderful treat; and sleeping in the sumptuous bed ensconced in luxurious linens was a soothing invitation to blissful sleep. What integrity JAYS international staff exhibits! Honestly among the many wonderful memories I have of my week in Paris, the friends I made at JAYS top the list. After all, it’s about the people. Thanks to everyone who took care of me. I appreciate everything and miss all of you. Thanks again for making my holiday special! P.S. I still miss your espresso machine! Wish I had one! Hope to see all of you again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Paris gem”
Reviews.Author: tutankarma
Reviews.Content: We would like to send our appreciation via this review for the wonderful time we had at Jays. We love visiting Paris but this time was particularly special because of the beauty and charm of this hotel. The suites are divine – we were upgraded to a large and exquisitely decorated suite which was SO comfortable that we yearned to return each day. But above all, it was the staff who were quite exceptional in their warmth and helpfulness in meeting all of our needs. There is so much more we could say but it would be redundant in the light of previous comments. Clearly, this is a hotel that recognises the importance of finding and retaining and excellent dedicated staff, and of providing the highest in quality and service. In a nutshell, for us Jays is synonymous with Paris. Once again thank you for making our stay so special.

Reviews.Title: “An extraordinary small hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikePrinceton
Reviews.Content: I won't repeat the details that have been covered so well below: the exceptional staff, the warm, welcoming, familial atmosphere, the great comfort of the rooms. We looked forward to a glass of champagne or a cup of coffee with other guests and staff members at the end of a day--something unthinkable in most hotels. We enjoyed every aspect and every minute of our stay, and we're enormously grateful to Judy and her whole team. The 16th isn't the liveliest district in town: it is wealthy, private, sedate. But the hotel is an easy walk to two different metro lines. We ate most of our meals in the series of great bistros that offer meals for around 30 Euros-La Régalade, L'ami Jean, Christophe, and those are all on the left bank. But it is an easy walk to the Pont d'Alma, and there is a great clump of bistros in the 7th between the Eifel Tower and the Invalides. Highest recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Didnt meet our high expectations”
Reviews.Author: TOPGUN71
Reviews.Content: Having read tripadvisor for so many hotel reviews last summer, we eventually decided on Jays because of the overall comments-despite the price! It is on a quiet street-in fact you would hardly know its there, it just has a small plaque outside. we were slightly taken aback with the small reception area and it is not like a hotel lobby where you can lounge or chill out in. Our room was large and well decorated but was cold at night and after walking all day the only way to warm up was to have a shower or get into bed!!The bathroom was acually warmer due to the lovely heated towel rail. Personally i would rather have a warm room than a 200 year old wardrobe! and at 375 euro per night i expect more than a plug in small blow heater which is clearly not sufficient. Only half of the fixed shower head actually worked which was disappointing and the pull out shower head in the bath had a leaky hose. Might sound trivial i know but this is not a cheap boutique hotel and i thus i would expect the same high standards of luxury hotels. Despite this there are lovely complimentary clarin products which were a lovely treat and the staff left us strawberries and grapes on valentines night. The hotel is 5min to trocadero and champs elysess and is very central. Think our next trip will be to another luxury hotel in different area.

Reviews.Title: “service with a special ace from mr and mrs oates”
Reviews.Author: N_irelandJonzo
Reviews.Content: well what can i say that has not already been pointed out, again all reviews are spot on with this hotel service is the key, they can not do enough for you and with charm and a certain down to earth attitude i have to say i will return again next year , the location is quite brilliant and i must admit that the guys on reception are phillipe and gerrit who i must say were the best front off house i have had the pleasure to meet, two other guys in reception were also very good but there names elude me so thanks to all who made it a great stay and il see you again next year

Reviews.Title: “Hotel within a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mindwanderer
Reviews.Content: Let's say you want to go to Paris and enjoy a fantastic hotel experience with individualized attention, lovely surrounds, and the feeling that you really matter at the place you're staying. One option would be to pay for a suite at one of the top 5 star hotels, so that you become one of their "special" guests. But in Paris, this costs over 1500 Euro per night. So a better option, unless you are fabulaously rich, is to stay at Jay's in Paris, where for less than the price of a regular room at one of the 5 star hotels you stay in a renovated townhome near the Arc de Triomphe with some of the best service in all of Paris. Jays has a total of 5 rooms. All are generously sized and made of one large room with attached bathroom. Each is individually decorated - and their website gives good pictures of what to expect in each room. I advise looking at the website and finding the style that suits you the most, and also putting in your request when you reserve; but bottom line is you can't really go wrong. The ceilings are tremendously high, the windows grand and plentiful, and the furnishings are unique and luxurious. It is truly like staying in the top level of a 5 star "hotel within a hotel." You do give up the 24-hour room service, the elevator (Jays has 3 levels, if stairs are tough ask for a room on 1st level), the swimming pool and gym, and the in-house fancy restaurant. You get superb 24-hour service though, and at Jays you matter - because you are never less than one of their 5 most important guests. Gerrit and Phillip do an excellent job and really make you feel welcome and important. They are ready with advice, individualized print-outs to guide you, and always there with a cup of tea or fresh coffee in the lovely lounge if you like. And at Jays that coffee or tea comes from one of the most exclusive Parisien gourmet stores - and it is gratis for you, unlike at the 5 stars where every little thing costs an arm and a leg.
